text:
I gave this hotel 2 stars because I did not see any mice, roaches or bed bugs in my room.

The key to staying at this hotel is have your paperwork in order if you don't they will double charge you....that's just the way it is. I booked this hotel through priceline made sure not to give my credit card to the hotel.

Do not give these people your credit card. 

I wanted an early check-in but they wanted to charge me an additional $14.95 resort fee for checking in before 11am. The resort fee is an additional $14.95 per night. I waited until 11am to check in.

The resort fee is for internet service in your room supposedly...I believe it's just a way for the hotel to make more money.

When I did check in the woman at the front desk tried to charge me for 5 night resort fee when I only paid for 4 nights through price line. I had to correct her by showing her my price line paperwork.

I used cash for $100 refundable incidental deposit and the 3 night resort fee which was slightly under $60.

They tried to put me in a handicapped room (don't know why) but I requested a regular room instead.

During check in if you don't correct these people early they will double charge you or give you a terrible room. I still ended up with a really bad room.

The room I had was in the basement the window view was an outside wall. The bathtub was clogged with hair an green slimy stuff. I tried to pour bleach in it to unclog it but that did not work. The bathroom sink had hair in it. The carpet looked old dingy and dirty.

The entire room reeked of cigarette smoke.

The buffet was bad.....for some reason it looked like the food had been sitting out all day without being stirred or freshened up or replace and it was not cheap.  Dinner cost $12. 

I didn't complain to management about my experience at the hotel I didn't think they would do anything about it......according to the other reviews I read.

It's a cheap ran down smelly hotel.....at least I wasn't double charged. It's not the maid fault that the rooms are ran down.

This is not the place to stay if you're trying to spend your time on the strip, cause it's waaayy off the strip.  Sadly, it just wasn't that kind of trip for me this time.  I stayed here for a family event and I was pleasantly surprised, considering the reasonable room rate.  The rooms were nice, the place was well run, clean, and the staff was really cool. 

The casino floor is huge, and they have tons of penny slots which cracked me up; you're just not going to see that on the strip!  

We went to the buffet at Feast and GRUBBED.  You gotta love a place that lets me have okra, beet salad, catfish, chow mein, greens, fried rice, ribs and pasta!

I think when you stay at any station casino you aren't exactly a Vegas high roller who expecting the red carpet to be rolled out- but in many areas the Texas barely scored better than a Super 8 motel stay.  

Here are a few of the greatest hits:
1. The tub was filthy. Not surface dirty, but that deep down grime that only elbow grease gets out. We know, because my wife scrubbed it clean.

2. The vent had caked on dust and lint. Like- no one had EVER cleaned it before dust and lint. All the surfaces were equally dirty. Just running your hand on the sink top felt like you were caressing volcanic rock- all the built up grime creating the craters. Horrid and seriously uncool. 

3. Pillows please. King size bed came with 3 pillows standard. We called down for 3 more (wife and I both sleep with 3 each). We were told we could only have 2 more pillows. That it was their policy - only two extra!  

4.  On an 8 night stay, our sheets were only fully swapped on night 6, and only because I stripped the bed. I forgot to strip the pillow cases off- so those we had for all 8 nights. 

Would I stay again?  No. 

Overall the other staff (casino, security, Starbucks) were great, but if you are overnighting: stay across the street at the Fiesta.

The place has not changed at all after a 20 year gap.  Like me just older and not aging well.  I had stayed at a sister hotel and was impressed with that hotel for the money.  So I decided to give Texas a retry.  The sheets were clean but the overall room was not.  There was little smell of cigarette smoke in the room until I took a shower.  Also the floors were dirty, fixtures corroded, and mold. The room needed a thorough cleaning. I ate at the coffee shop for dinner and the service was above average.  The food was ok.  I had breakfast at the buffet.  I am gluten free and actually walked away full.  A good balanced breakfast.  Last fyi, there is no secured parking for guests, but the reservation person was kind enough to tell me where the security cameras were. All in all I felt safe staying here. Which at the downtown hotels has not always been the case.
ok the buffet is terrible. there was a cockroach running around like he owned the place near the omelette station. this place is pretty dead.

We love Station Casinos all over Vegas!   We are regulars.   Don't expect any southern hospitality at Texas Station- this is the worst one we have visited and the ONLY Station casino who's employees consistently have a bad attitude and are nasty to their guests.   Try next door at Fiesta for a great time!

This Hotel is awful! I checked in for a 3 night stay only to find the room in a state of completely unsanitary to say the least. Immediately upon entering the room I noticed a lot of debris on the carpet and brown stains and spills on the wall paper. There was crushed potato chips on the telephone and the furniture and lamp shades were badly damaged and in need of some serious repair or replacing not to mention the view was that facing a brick wall. I immediately called FD and informed them of the issues. Chris the agent was very apologetic and asked if he could room move me which I accepted. As I was on my way to meet friends for dinner I told Chris I would pick up keys to the new room later in the evening when I return from dinner. 

I hung up the phone to proceed to bathroom to get ready for my evening when I saw the condition of the bathroom. Literally there were urine stains on BOTH sides of the toilet base, hair on top of the toilet, hair on the floor, hair in the sink and hair in the shower. My stomach literally turned!! I immediately went to the FD to check out! I was no longer interested in occupying ANY of There rooms! I spoke to Chris at the FD and showed him all the pictures of the room. He apologized again saying "oh I'm sorry this is bad". Although Chris did not have the authority to refund my nights he gave me the contact info for the Hotel Director Roberto and asked me to call in the morning for the refund and he would make all the notations in my account. I occupied this disgusting room for 30mins! When I spoke to Roberto the next day he didn't once offer any type of apology. He just listened to my experience, put me on hold, and then returned to say he would only be refunding me 2nights and would be charging me for 1 night being that I declined to room move???? I could NOT believe what I wad hearing! I also work I'm Hotel Management so I could not believe Roberto handled this so poorly. It was his staff that failed to provide a clean and sanitary room, and yet somehow it's MY fault and I must pay for walking in and declining to do business with them? I informed Roberto that I would be contacting someone higher in position as I would definitely will not be paying for some place I did not stay as a result of there incompetence. I was not only late for my dinner reservations with my friends as a result of this, but I also found my self at 9pm with no place to stay for the next 3days. I needed to now try to rebook hotel reservations elsewhere in the middle if the night. Roberto really seemed as if he could care less only saying "well there's no one else to talk to I'm the highest up" I informed him I would be contacting the Corp. office, which I immediately did after ending our conversation. When I spoke with Station casinos Corp. office the polite women listened to me and informed me that Roberto was not the highest level on property and there was a General Manager I could speak with. She gave me his contact info and his secretary~ Sofia's number and said she was certain they could help me. I contacted Sofia who was very polite and apologetic, and said although the GM was in meetings all day, she would get with Roberto and see what happened and would be contacting me back that day. She did! Sofia later said that when she contacted Roberto, he said he was refunding all 3 nights and I wouldn't be charged for anything! I thanked Sofia for her prompt assistance. But that's when the nightmare began....my credit card would go on to be charged, and the partially refunded, only to be charged again, and then partially refunded, and then literally charged a 3rd time!!!! In the end, I still paid for 1 night at the Texas!! No full refund was ever given. It has been 3wks. And nothing. After this terrible experience Texas had the nerve to charge me 1night room, tax and resort fee for minutes of me being inside there disgusting room. My booking agent is still investigating but EVERYTIME they contact Texas, there are told I won't be charged!! But the reality is I have been charged....repeatedly!! Do yourself a favor and DO NOT book here....what a nightmare!!!! I am trying to upload my pictures of the horrible condition of the room but somehow am unable to on Yelp? I will upload the pictures on Trip Advisor!

Thank you so much for providing a family stay at Texas Station.  Trish at check in met all of our request and room accommodations, very nice, informative, and efficient, making our check in experience smooth.  Hotel Management, Greg was extremely friendly and took all of our needs into consideration.  Amazing customer service!  Thank you!!

This review only relates to the Oyster Bar at Texas Station.

Their decision to do away with the "lunch portions" will result in the elimintion of their lunch business.

Dumb!

We have stayed at the Texas Station in the past and it's a decent hotel for the price but last week we had a booking issue that prevents me from returning.  We were called on our arrival day and told that the 4 rooms we booked were not available and that we had been moved to a sister hotel 20 miles away.  We accepted the situation but we had two nights and did not want to have to move between hotels.  Hotel reservations at the Texas Station told us that we would need to speak with the manager Amalia Armen to get our prepaid room transferred to the sister hotel - but that she was in a meeting and could not talk with us at the time.  We left a message but never got a return phone call.  The sister hotel even tried to handle this for us but Amalia's solution was to dodge the conversation.  Not the kind of "hospitality" I'm looking for when I stay at a hotel.

This is our local gambling place.  They have one of the best rewards programs I've found.  The casino floor isn't so crowded that you feel like you are sitting on top of the group next to you - but close enough to enjoy if someone close let's out a scream for a hit.  Contrary to one of the reviews, we've consistently found the smoke level low in the casino and the smokers very polite in checking to see if you would be bother.  I agree that the buffet isn't going to set the world on fire - but for $5 where can you get a drink, custom made omelet and sweet for dessert?  And as to the comment regarding the age of the gamblers - I see more people younger than I am playing and I haven't left my 50's yet.

Next time you are in town - sit down, try a game (don't always play maxi) and converse with a local - most of them are pretty darn nice.

The hotel is a great value for those staying in Las Vegas. It is north of Las Vegas, so a little bit of a drive from the Strip. Fine, if you have a car. The room itself was pretty nice. No smells, spacious, unlike other rooms I've stayed at in Vegas. The sheets, like another commenter noted, there is no duvet. Just two flat sheets with a fleece blanket. The fan works well. You have to put your card (or any card) into the socket near the door to activate the electricity.

They loose a star due to the internet situation being confusing. You have it free in the casino, so just make it free in the rooms, unlike this Cox Hospitality business. My advice? If you want to use the internet? Just go into the main casino. It's completely free there.

They also give you free slot play when you join the club ($3-$500). Of course, got the $3. It's confusing on how to use it, but basically it reimburses you for the money sort of... But the card is of better value for the buffet, which gives you discount. For breakfast, you can't beat $5 buffet... See the buffet review for more info.

The food is pretty good staff are on it when it comes to picking up plates, took kids our first time visiting Texas Station Casino, has arcade, cinema inside, the kids had a good time. Definitely coming back, by unanimous vote we give this place 4 stars, thanks nieces and nephews for your participation.

I like the Texas Station.
Compared to the Strip Casinos it is very relaxed and laid back here.
No bad room. Ideal size for two people with king size bed.  Looking forward to show tonight. Clean with plenty of amenities.

This review is for Craps only.  I arrived here last Friday night around 6 P.M. and the craps table was empty.  Here I was thinking WTF is going on?  How can one of the more profitable table games be empty on such a busy night?  I jump on the table and make a few bets and start me roll.  I dabble in controlled shooting, but most casinos don't really care if players set the dice.  NOT HERE!  After my first set of rolls (pit boss is watching the whole time) I hit my point and they switch stick-men.  The new stick-man stares at the pitboss, and as I'm starting my roll puts his stick out over the rail and in front of my shot... My dice hit his stick and I seven out.  I then politely ask if he can move his arm back just a little bit, as I'm not able to shoot around him.  He yells at me, saying that he needs to put his stick out to protect himself from the players and I can either step back, or leave the table....  I took my chips off the table and cashed out.  No wonder no one plays craps here.  If your looking for a good time, go somewhere else.

Found a good deal on Travelocity. But treated with contempt by staff and charged additional $15 at the desk as part of the a MANDATORY basic package fee. Not impressed with their business model. Will not be staying here again.

My family and I recently stayed at this hotel to attend the wedding of a family member. The hotel staff greeted us and provided excellent customer service. After checking in, we thought "Hey, this place seems alright." WRONG!!!!!!!

First, the room: We requested a non-smoking room and got one, but It was filled with smoke the entire stay, leaving me, my mom and my husband with horrible headaches. We smelled like 3 smoke stacks on the way home and forcing us to have to take our luggage directly to the laundry room to be washed when we got home. Now, our car has the glorious smell of smoke. 

The toilet in our room made a horrendous sound upon flushing that would scare the living daylights out of you. The sink made a sound as to indicate a possible clog in the drain. 

The furniture in the room looked like it had been purchased from a junk yard. It was filthy. 

The walls in the room are paper thin providing us with the play-by-play conversations of the guests in the rooms next door. 

The elevators: Ride at your own risk! They both seem like they could use some much needed maintenance. 

The hallways: Hot as hell! No a/c blowing so you feel as though you are holding your breathe until you get to the elevators. 

The wedding ceremony and reception were absolutely wonderful and we had a great time until we went back to our smoke-filled room.

I went to the bowling alley for my sons birthday! They reserved our alleys like I had asked which was great! But the computers were outdated and kept breaking down the bowling alley employees had great customer service. And overall the bowling experience was great. We also orders pizzas and wings with drinks to eat and the food was good however the service was bad idk if they were overwhelmed with the amount of people that were there. But they were extremely rude.

This place is all right! 
As we are primarily video poker players, it really doesn't get much better than Texas Station. http://static3.px.yelp.com/photo/EdHm2gXRR-IqKLdatxIkfQ/l  
The pay tables are excellent, the machines are clean, seats are comfortable, and the cocktail service is friendly and attentive. Music is decent and at a good level and the crowd is primarily local, which is great. 
With a rental car we were able to visit from the strip several times, at a much lower cost than taxis and self parking is well-lit and easily accessible. 
Would we stay here?  No, not our kind of place.  
Will we continue to play here?  No doubt about it!
And again, FATBURGER!

This is a very conveniently located and friendly location.  The staff here are very attentive and helpful as well as courteous to newcomers.  I have brought several friends over with me and they were very welcoming even though I was the only paying customer those visits.  Also their buffet is very easy on the wallet for visitors or people you want to treat on a regular basis.

As we are sitting in the parking lot waiting for the rest of our party to meet us apparently it is a problem according to Paul who worked there. Even though there is no sign posted!!! We are now at another casino because if we cannot sit there and wait for our friends I do not want to ever go there. Thank you Paul for losing money from about ten people that were going to have a good night at the Texas!!

I just got done eating breakfast and the food is great. However, today I had the worst server that bussed my table. First off, it's pretty hot outside and I'm sure people like cold refreshing beverages. She brought me some orange juice with no ice and I'm not gonna drink anything that isn't cold. I went up to get some more food, come back and my table is cleared?? Secondly, the servers aren't supposed to bus a table until the people are finished eating. I find it rude and I told the manager about the situation and she really didn't handle the problem right. She herself grabbed a plate of food and started eating. I usually get better service than this... Station Casinos need to pay a little bit more attention to what their doing. I like the buffet, but the waitress was dumb as hell ! If you guys want tips, do your jobs right... However, you guys don't need any tips because I'm pretty sure they make enough money and I'd say they make at least up to $10 an hour for their job. Other than that the food is good and I love the omelettes.

This casino is close to home  has a movie theater food drinks  gaming rooms bowling almost you Need I fricken love it

Kids quest movies or bowling for the kids 

Food corts restaurant an oyster bar and a buffet

Lots of bars and machines to choose from

I performed for a convention here & absent mindedly left my prop bag behind. These folks, in particular Patricia in Catering services & Jason from the bowling alley, were beyond kind & professional helping me find this very valuable item. They were also absolutely dandy & the reason for our very successful convention. This is the stuff of greatness folks. Thankee Patricia & Jason!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Texas Station is cool with me for three reasons:

1. Lack of scene. If you're mediocre on the strip, you are smokin' here.  When I'm feeling unattractive, this is my go-to spot.

2.  No customers.  Sometimes, I hate people and want to be far away from them all.  This place is deserted.  So, thanks, Texas Station, for contributing to my misanthropy.

3.  Everything under one roof.  Theaters, bowling alley, oyster bar, sub par buffet, Dairy Queen, a ballroom where I once spent three hellish days, and a gift shop.  If I ever decide to pull a Howard Hughes, I'm going here.
THEY HAVE MICE!!! I was very uncomfortable! They had to call eco lab and they moved me to another room so that I could take a shower and check out! They were nice but the hotel is not good!

Wow, this place sucks so much. I didn't know what I getting into when I bought the Groupon deal. I will never go back. Worst hotel ever. Located smack middle of ghetto surrounded by housing projects. Just look at the kinds of people that comes here. 

Last night, there were idiots making huge noise at 1 am and the security never showed up. Seriously? 

I learned my lesson. I just wrote Groupon and demanded my money back. Stay the heck away especially if you family.
This place was horrible.    Horrible service and the person next to me had his money stolen from his room by housekeeping. Don't stay here

Super cheap breakfast. I forgot to mention you get what you pay for. Las Vegas Known for late night deals. With 6 dollar steak and eggs and 3 dollar burger and fries. We were in for a wake up call. Service was great, bad timing though, they were apparently cleaning the grill. It took us almost an hour to get our food.Dried steak that should have been called beef jerky and eggs. I had the chicken fried steak and eggs. I couldn't even tell it was steak and it had lots of chewy pieces. My friends burger was cold and looked like a mcdouble from mcDonalds. The advertised quarter pounder was not impressive. For a few bucks more save your gas and spends the extra dough on something of better quality.

Not as great as I'd remembered. I went there to see a movie recently with my girlfriend, when the movie started it was us and another couple in the theater. By the time the movie had ended, half the theater was full. All those movie hoppers going in and out of the theater as it was playing were pretty distracting. Damn kids! The government really should make it mandatory to get a license to breed. If you want to have kids, you should have to fill out an application, get a background check, etc. And only two kids per couple like it is in China. Also, any time a woman is knocked up without first applying to have a child should get a mandatory abortion. 
Two stars because they do have Yellow Brick Road on Saturdays, a great band.

I bowl league here every Friday and am greeted every week at the bar with my drink of choice by Jaime. Best bartender around. Very attentive and personable. I look forward to Fridays because of him. Keep up the good work.

I've only gambled at the Texas casino I haven't stayed in their rooms. I love gambling here. The atmosphere is always on point and always win some little extra money to go shopping at the outlets.  As long as you're gambling the drinks keep on coming. The only down side is if they don't have enough personnel some gambling tables are not open. For example last night (Sunday) they had 2 craps tables open. One was completely f the other one only half of it was open because they didn't have enough personnel. But other than that I rather gamble at the Texas than the strip.
Not much of a gambler but their buffet is above average considering the price. It's also not far from where I live which is a bonus!

I had a bad feeling from the moment we checked in. We received horrible service. The front counter rep wouldn't even make eye contact, was rude and not help full at all. We had a room on the 5th floor and it was a long walk down the hall. OK, but we had to go downstairs 2 times because our room keys would not work. We didn't even get a "sorry for the inconvenience". We asked for a non-smoking room and it smelled like 5 people had just been smoking in there. The elevators where very noisy and extremely slow. The elevator doors would open on the wrong floor all the time. The Casino was pretty dirty. We were there a couple of days and every where we sat to play the slots there would be cigarette butts and dirty ash trays. No one was going buy to pick them up and clean. Even if I were a smoker i would want to use a clean tray. We also never once got to order from the cocktail girls. They were never around. We got wrong directions from a couple of the employees about the casino. We were looking for particular bars to take advantage of the specials they had but kept walking back and forth because no one seemed to know where it was We had breakfast at their Coco's and no joke, we waited 6 minutes to be seated, and 13 minutes to at least ask for our coffee. It was not busy, only 4 tables were occupied including ours. I am the type of person that can deal with all of the above, except the horrible customer service.

If I could give no starts I would!! WORST BUFFET customer service there is. The so called "manager" Maria Inez was extremely rude, cursing , and talking down on the customers!!! In front of many customers that were in line to enter she was cursing in Spanish and yelling at another customer. She was also treating him like he didn't have money after He had paid in full. She was telling him she was going to call security if her bill wasn't taken care of and that she specifically told the customer in front of everyone that she didn't care what he had to say because it wasn't her problem and that all she cared about was getting her money. That is disgusting of a so called manager. When they asked her who was her manager she ignored the customer and refused to give them their name. I hope that they call corporate on her!!!!!
i love the Texas!! its a cool layed back casino for the locals to cash their checks and get free stuff with a drink on the rocks!! love it!

Front desk staff nice...no bell hop we were allowed to use cart though...only saving grace was oyster bar which was good..bed sheets and pillow stank like they had not been cleaned..When I called housekeeping was told they were short staff and had all left for night so we could not get extra pillows or replacement sheets. would have been better to sleep in the rest area...cigarette smell heavy also.
It's a locals Casino. A step or two above Arizona Charlie's. The buffet is craptastic besides the Mexican fare.   #shrugs#

..Station Casinos runs a great operation across all their casinos 
..this place is fun and staff always makes sure i'm taken care of
..go on a friday night, chill, and listen to the live band

Overnight at Texas Hotel Station. It's not one of those 5 star hotels along the Las Vegas Strip that has all the amenities. For about $150 a night including taxes and resort fees, I find the price quite expensive. The hotel room is spacious and clean. But they don't have fee coffee or free breakfast like what most hotels offer. I was given a room at the first floor and I don't have a good view. This hotel has many restaurants. I had my breakfast at Cafe Grande. I ordered fried catfish and eggs and find their price also quite pricey! The food is not bad but not also great.  I liked their Dallas Ballroom where the event took place. It's spacious and accommodate all the vendors and guest. Parking is free. Overall my experience is good.

I didn't stay here, I don't want to stay here ... but I had a theory that older casinos, catering to less affluent folks, may have frequent pay-outs.  (If you read my review about another tired casino, you'll see that I find it fun to win even a couple of cents when I pull the lever.  Clearly, I'm no gambler.)

I was right!  I kept winning ten cents here, a dollar there!  I was pleased.  What made me particularly happy was Texas Station's frozen margaritas.  Pretty darned good!  (I don't think patrons at this casino regularly tip the barmaids.  The gal who helped us was overly effusive about our gratuity.)

The one downside of the casino floor: skeevy men kept hitting on my daughter, one even handing her a drink.  (Like she's going to take a drink from a stranger!)

While I would never make this place my haunt, I'll probably come back to play the slots on my next trip.  My daughter probably will not.

Texas is no way near as polished as the strip casino's and has way less tourists (like me). Excellent for some undisturbed 
roulette. Loved playing old skool bingo in the even more old skool hall. Staff is very friendly. The place feels real, no frills.

This review is based on the food buffet and the bowling alley.  Me and my husband went there on a Sunday.  We did not have to stand in line too long and it wasn't crowded either.  We were seated pretty quickly and then we immediately started our trip around the buffet.  

There wasn't much of a variety of foods and it was around 3pm and they still had old crusty dry breakfast food out.  There wasn't any fried chicken, fish, shrimp, etc available.  All I got was some barbeque chicken, slice of pizza, taco, salad, sausage and peppers.  The food was pretty good however there just wasn't enough variety for me like at Boulder Station.

This is probably the last place I would come if I wanted to come to a buffet but I would try them out again if I just had to.

Now the bowling was pretty fun and awesome.  We bowled 3 games and rented 2 pairs of shoes for about $32.00.  Not too bad for a Sunday afternoon.  It wasn't crowded and they had a lot of the lanes blocked off because of a bowling league.  We also quenched our thirst with the $.99 cent Margaritas.  They aren't too strong but pretty good for the price.  Me and my family always come here and it's usually 20 of us so it was nice to have just the 2 of us playing. 

Of course I will be returning to the bowling alley as it is always fun fun fun.

Texas Station or bust -I'LL TAKE BUST

TEXSH#T Station - I use Yelp all of the time, but have never before left a review.  I am writing this one while in my room at Texas Station.  PLEASE heed my warning and don't stay here!  This place is disgusting!  There is a stench outside of raw sewage that permeates throughout the hotel and smells sooooo bad it was hard to sleep in the room with window shut and AC running.  We were forced to stay here with son's hockey team and even for one night it is AWFUL!!!!!!  Spoke to the manager and he ignored me and said I am only one who complained of the stench.  I doubt it since every parent on our team has complained when they step outside how awful the smell is.  The sink, tub and shower  have such slow drains that you are standing in 6 inches of water before you realize that yes, the drain is open!  If there was actually any water pressure, tub and sink would overflow before water drained out.    They ought to implode this place, but it is in such a bad area that no one would buy the property!  Any positive reviews are obvious plants by hotel staff.  Y'all Come Back Now - I think NOT...

When checking in, Trisha, was so rude and smug. She would not allow me to use the card they had on file, which was my husbands (as we were just advised over the phone we could use and i had the actual card in hand.) So i had to use my card. Thankfully on check out, i had Victoria, who was very nice and helpful. 

Other than this, our bathroom was not very clean. There was pubic hair on the floor. Do not waste your money on the buffet. Go to tue Grand Cafe instead. Food is better. 

I'll end on a good note. I wish i got his name, but the older gentelman bartender who worked the night shift on 8/16-17/17, was great. He rememberd our drinks when we came back the next night. Also, housekeeping was quick to get us towels. i am on the fence about staying here again.

We were very disappointed and disgusted in the room they gave us. First of all, there were no non-smoking rooms available at the time. Upon check-in, I inspected the bathroom and found the following: 1) a strand of pubic hair on the soap next to the sink faucet, 2) another strand of pubic hair on the sink countertop, 3) soap on the bathtub towel that was reused as it was dry but the wrapping looked as if it got wet prior, 4) water on the bathroom floor by the tub b/c I accidentally stepped in it, and 5) strands of hair under the comforter sheets! 

After disclosing the uncleanliness of the room to Donna, who checked us in at the front desk, she did not show the least ounce of apology or shame. She informed us that there were no rooms available for the night and to try again in the morning. I felt disgusted that I had to sleep in that room that night. Fortunately, in the morning, another agent was able to find an open room and relocate us. This room was much cleaner than the previous one. This establishment gets ONE STAR, for the 2 complimentary buffet tickets given for our troubles.

If you're on a budget, take your chances in staying here. As for us, we'll splurge a little more next time and stay on the strip in a better quality hotel.

worst customer service ever. this place deserves negative stars. not to mention the hints of racism because my parents couldnt speak english to their preference. went through 4 different reps before they could fix a simple problem.
Neisha at the Registration desk is terrific! Many thanks go to her! - Joann Ross at Lucix, Director of Quality Assurance! Suggestion: you will get more business with more Neisha's around!

Well they have an arcade...

The arcade is fun and super cheap and if you take a movie ticket stub they give you $5 a stub to play in the arcade :) (not sure if this in an ongoing thing) we were excited to see a bunch of skeetball machines (our fav). 

We each played on our free credits there for it seemed like forever :) husband and I then pulled out winning tickets together and got a prize, it was a little colorful spinning top  filled with water and fish (or something). 

Anyway if you want to smell like smoke for the next century or check out a movie in an uncomfortable but regular priced run down theater, then get free arcade play go here. 

Otherwise...enjoy the $8.99? Syco provided buffet and drink all you can drink at the penny slots...or don't (just like we didn't). 

Oh and I think they have a food court.

This place sucks! The room was clean, but there are a LOT of undesirables here, and the walls are paper-thin, I could hear the lady next door talking about buying her grandchildren chocolate through the walls!  The tv changed on its own, and the staff was unprofessional, would not recommend.

I have had disappointing cheap buffets in Las Vegas before. And ive had amazing ones that emptied my wallet...The Feast at Texas Station hit a high middle ground . Very good food , Wide array if choices , at an extremely affordable cost.

The Texas Station is part of the old guard of Station Casinos.  There's a new school crop including Green Valley Ranch, Red Rock and Aliante.  This place definitely ain't in that league.  At the same time it's not the worst locals casino I've been to.

Texas Station isn't really a destination spot.  I can't imagine saying "I've gotta go watch the game at Texas Station" when there are so many other options.  You literally have to live right next to the place for it to have any kind of appeal.  There is a movie theatre inside, which is pretty decent.  I think I saw Oceans 12 there.  And in a moment of being a cheap bastard, I actually stayed here once when visiting Vegas for a weekend from San Diego.  Room must have cost me less than $50.

The bigger draw seems to be events.  Election night parties and job fairs are common at Texas Station.  They have a pretty decent sized convention/meeting area which must be cheaper than some of the more A-list places in town.  There's almost always some D-list live band playing at the wannabe club zone.  I think it was called the Armadillo last I remember.

You have dozens of better options than Texas Station, but at least you won't be grossed out when hanging out here.

Crikey! What an awesome feeling to be recognized by name or by your choice of drink. He he he he. This is my favorite Station Casino and although it's due to the close proximity to my home, it also has much to do with how they treat me. I truly love Texas Station due to how they take good care of me, an exhausted Strip casino employee.

I have come here for several years for two reasons; they treated my mother like gold and I am able to kick back and decompress here. 

The various bars are hosted by really cool barkeeps that know you by name or recognize you as you walk by. From the Martini Bar to the Sports Bar, these guys know how to take good care of the customer. I am speaking more of how they interact with their customer than how they make a drink. They genuinely chit chat with their regular customers like a friend. 

It's not fair to mention names because everyone from the security department ensuring you find your vehicle to the IM department keeping everything clean and sanitary is here for ONE reason, to keep you happy. 

Yes, I love the Strip and it's awesome and distinct properties, yet, there's something about the Texas Station experience that keeps locals coming back regularly. They treat you like gold!

Texas Station has various restaurants and a wide selection of fast food joints. They have a movie theater, bowling alley, a Fun Zone for kids, and slot machines that have paid the electricity bill in the past. 

In my opinion employees like Shawn from the Sports Bar and Marty from their "We Love Locals" commercials exemplified the quality of customer service. Once again I hate and apologize for mentioning names. 

The Fertitta brothers have truly honored their parents in keeping up the old school standards. Thank you Texas Station employees!

This review is for the Feast buffet inside the Texas station casino...first off its pretty cheap, second the staff is great and very helpful..we love the Mexican food station..love the carnitas..their rice is very good...they have a few stations...Italian..American...Chinese..but Mexican was the station for me...I tried the fried chicken..usually my fav food..this was freshly made so I hoped that they would be great but it was just ok..skip the dessert..not worth the calories..all in all though a good experience..

We had a cricket in our room and we kick it out. My brothers room had a horrible sewage problem and had to get a new room. Room stunk like sewage. 

Idk. We had mixed service some great and some horrible.

I was staying with my boyfriend while I was in town. The room was great and clean. I would have given five if they had coffee pots in the room, but the Texas removed all the coffee pots because of fire risk. The front desk lady said that there was a Starbucks around the corner, if we really wanted coffee. Other than missing the coffee pot, it's a great place. The bowling alley is open late and when you check in you get a coupon for a free game.

The buffett kept me thinking of the movie, Super-size Me, because everything was so salty, deep fried, or swimming in gravy; Although I must give Texas Station kudos for serving Menudo; again the Menudo was way too salty. I ended up skipping the buffett and settling for the Grand Cafe where I had omlets. My room made me think of what a half-way house must be like. Do not expect pillow-top mattresses or chocolates. I had to call the front desk three days in a row before the plumber showed up with a bottle of Draino-O to unclog the face bowl drain! I would have checked out after day one but I was attending a class nearby and my room was pre-booked. There was a dog obedience conference held at the hotel while I was there. Some of my classmates complained of dogs barking and crying all night!  What ever you do, I suggest not considering this place for a honeymoon otherwise you may end-up getting annulled in the morning-enuff said :-(

Cool place. Way off the strip, north Vegas but I stayed for work so I didn't care. The rooms were a good size, lots of places to eat and few bars around the casino. I enjoyed my time here for sure. Most the staff I came across was low key chill.

This is for the buffet only at Texas Station.  My relatives come here to gamble.  But I was just there for the food, at lunch.  They take me trhough the long line.  Since they are frequent gamblers, my meal was about $7.00 with a frequent gambling card.  I honestly don't know how much it is for the non gambling types, probably other reviewers will say.

This buffet is huge - twice the size of neighboring Fiesta Station's buffet. It must be about 100 feet long. I decided to walk and see what was there before making choices.  Nice American section which was the largest.  They had a slab of roast beef and ham, so you wait in line to get a cut.  Or, you can have them make you a chargrilled hamburger, or grill your self-created burrito in the Mexican section.  I had no patience for any of that.  First plate - They had a decent barbecue section, and I got some ribs with collards, cole slaw, and corn on the cob with some fried rice and orange chicken from the next door Chinese section.  They had some good hot and sour soup, but there is also a soup section next to the Mexican section. Back to the BBQ section, my sister had some of the pulled pork, it was was good. 

Most everything was good.  I didn't go to their large salad bar which had things like pear halves and various lettuces, fresh fruit (watermelon and cantaloupe) and pre made salads.  Surprisingly, that was the least busy area.

They had a Cajun section with fish and seafood gumbo with dirty rice.  They even had hush puppies and corn fritters but I didn't try any. So, for plate number 2, I decided to get fried chicken which was just OK and more vegetables.  And,t the vegetables were good - glazed yams, steamed beans, and more collards again. I also got some penne pasta with a meatball and sauce.  

In light of my doctor's command that I minimize my time and volume eating at buffets (geez there are a LOT of happy but big bodied eaters here!) I stopped at plate 2 and opted for some desserts.  The 20 different pies, cookies, and cakes looked good, and there were even some no sugar added creations.  But I decided on eating two of the mousse in a cup - one was vanilla cream with chocolate, the other was cream with a strawberry glze.  Thank God they only came in 3 oz. containers, it was rich and probably bad for you.  I also had a red velvet cupcake - kind of dry but pretty. 

My eyes wanted to try more things, but maybe we can go again soon. It was time to gamble before heading home.  It might sound like this is like Hometown Buffet, but really, the food is way better and there is greater variety.

One thing I hate about Vegas casinos, though, is all the smoking in the casino.  So if that bugs you, beware.  Also, it you're with someone who uses a cane, ask them if they'd prefer getting pushed in a wheelchair.  They also have valet parking. This place is huge and is a challenge for those who can't walk a quarter mile by the time you park, go to the buffet, and walk back out to the car.

Pros: 
Everything in one place (hotel dining gaming bowling theatre shop etc)
Customer service, friendly staff (some not so much)
Free parking
Bowling was fun 
HUGE casino

Cons:
Expensive for the quality of the room  $78 my goodness!!!
Non smoking rooms were unavailable!!!!!!!
Room was stink, dirty, light bulb was out
Shower trickles water
No in room fridge
Food was blaaaah 
Can't call in food to pick up downstairs
No room service

I wouldn't stay there again :(

This hotel and Casino really sucks! I was at the slots and every employee that would pass by i would ask for the waitress, because I wanted to order a drink...  Well i spent $80 on the 1 cent slot and never saw a waitress..! I waited for 2 hrs! I guess at this hotel customer service is not an important factor!  Never coming back here AGAIN!!

I gave 2 stars because the casino manager was nice. But yeahhhhh, don't think I will be back here anytime soon. Our room I though was ok until I noticed a few things that bothered me. One the smell, it's as if someone was chain smoking in there. Two, the bed was not comfortable. Three, like most yelp review mention the shower head in the bathroom needs help. Four, I had ( I won't say what ) crawl on my face at 745am and that was the last straw! Management team handled it as best as they can but that that point I don't think anything can change my mind I WAS DONE!!!!!!. Really wanted to like this place but it's just not for me. I had to many expectations and I think that is where I messed up! Ohh  yeah, the buffet spot was good but that still didn't make up for the other stuff.

Booked a room online.  Get a call two days later and the day before I arrive to inform me that I didn't have a room.  They inform me that no room is available and they booked me in a sister property.  The problem is the sister property was 20 miles away.  I asked if there was a sister property closer by.  They said no available rooms.  

A friend decided to join me in Vegas and booked a room not 20 minutes earlier in their sister property (Palace Station) that was 5 miles away and closer to the Strip.  

Not Happy.  

I ended up booking another hotel at about the same rate and literally 1/2 mile from their sister
Property. 

Needless to say, I will not be staying at any Station property in the future.

Stayed here a couple days after Christmas 2017.  
Kinda crummy, clean enough rooms, but crummy, not enjoyable. 
No refrigerator or coffee maker in room.  No USB or connections for PC devices. Bathroom sinks gurgle loudly as they drain (both times I've stayed here in different rooms).  Could hear noisy neighbors in the next room quite clearly.  Oh MY!   
The Gideons have not been here, or placed a Bible in the nightstand.
Previous guest had put plastic bag over the smoke detector, apparently to smoke something in the room (these types of guests).  
The pool is like the one in your backyard, small, shallow (4 feet deep), and ugly, surrounded by block wall next to the parking lot.
BUT, if you like BOWLING, they have a big bowling alley!  
Bare bones rooms.  No room service food.  Buffet gets a C+.  
Casino is just ok.  Mainly took my money.  
Bar tender at the "Cadillac El Dorado" bar had a bad attitude and seemed to hate his job. Gruff.   
Locals like this place due to less tourists and IT's CHEAP.  
It's quite a distance from the "Strip" area in a not-so-great neighborhood on Rancho Drive north of the "Downtown" Casino area.
Main Street Station is better; at least they have a brewery and restaurant that is good.  I wouldn't recommend Texas Station.  I won't be returning.

Well first off it was really cheap...really really cheap.
Forty bucks a night for a double, on a Thursday at that.
The down side is that is was quite the drive from the strip, a much longer one then i thought it would be.
The rooms are fantastic though!
Clean and huge :)
The buffet was mediocre but still satisfying, it was cheap so if your on a budget it gets the job done.
There was a seafood restaurant that i really wanted to try but never made it to.
As far as the gambling goes...i didn't win much but who really dose?

I was really against staying here, but booked the room in advance without doing any looking into. It was better than I was expecting. Just like almost any casino in vegas, it smells like cigarette. I don't even smoke and I didn't think it was the worst. Some people are little princesses.

We got a non-smoking room on the 6th floor. Room was surprisingly clean and didn't smell of smoke. Bathroom including toilet and bathtub were also clean. Halls were quiet and well air-conditioned. You can hear a few conversations as you walk to your room, but once inside, silence; no disturbances. Not the best view, window looked out to the wall of another building. The elevators...well, they're elevators. Not the fanciest, but who complains about elevators?

Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Payed everything in cash so i wouldn't have to deal with being over-charged or double-charged. No problems there. Didn't bother checking out the bowling alley or the pool...who wants to swim in a pool located on the garage level?...not me. Lots of slot machines to gamble away on.

Stay away from the café!! Food was disgusting. Old, stale, probably microwaved. I wouldn't wanna check out the buffet either. They have a small food court further down past a steakhouse and oyster bar that looked pretty nice.

For vegas, yes, not the nicest hotel you can stay in. But for someone looking for a cheap room off the strip, it's not that bad. (About a 10 min drive to vegas strip) Not trying to spend my whole trip in a hotel room anyway.

This is a review of both the hotel and the casino. 

It's a bit old but still decent. 

The crowd that frequents this place are locals and old. 

People don't come here to see or be seen as you can tell by their everyday fits.

The food is decent at the buffet you'll have fun without breaking the bank. 

It's easy to get in and out of and check in is a cinch. I've only stayed here once and for less than a night. Caught some rapid eye movement and showers then hit the road again. I can't truly complain as it was a comped room and I received free play just for checking in. 

It was a win win really. 

I probably wouldn't stay here again unless they complete an extreme overhaul. 

The casino is small and there are some sketchy looking people that hang around for the free drinks while playing 1 cent every ten minutes... So obvious lol!

This place is okay, and I'd consider staying again under the right circumstances.

I was at a conference, and the conference was at the hotel.  There were two problems at the conference that had to do with the facility.  The first was the air conditioning, as it was so effective that people were looking for coats.  The second was a public address system flaw in which we got to listen to the presentation that was going on next door for about three minutes.  Ultimately it was fixed.

The food at the conference was okay.  They had a nice variety of fruit, but the prepared items lacked the attention to detail that is possible.  Lunch was a cold cut, build your own sandwich bar, and there was plenty of food for everybody.  One of the cheeses provided looked a bit suspect, and so I  skipped that one, as it reminded me of sliced velveeta. They did serve a salad and it was, again, ok.  We did not eat in any of their restaurants and so there is no comment to make on them. 

The room was clean and that's always a good thing.  At check in I was made aware that I would be in a room with an unprecedented view of an adjoining wall, and that's what I had.  I had chosen 'quiet' when given the option, and this room did deliver that.  I'm writing this here for you, so that you, at check in, can be sure to ask about the view, especially if it's important to you.

Be sure and review the location of this place, as it does take some time to get to other places that you might want to go to.  You're away from the main action in Las Vegas.

When you compare this hotel to the big lavish places on the strip, obviously there is no comparison, but if you look at it for what it is, a neighborhood place providing a reasonable room rate, it's simply not too bad.

This is a great hotel, the rooms are clean and well maintained. The casino is unique in its own way and provides a very comfortable environment. They make it so you never have to leave the property with movies, bowling, and multiple bars. Id be happy staying here again
Went to buffet for the frist time waiting in line 30mine had the taco they where good but I am feeling sick since I left the casino BBQ was dry my room mate not feeling good even he went work

This location is becoming really run down. I've never really expected it to be good because of the neighborhood it's in. People in those areas do not take care of their things and do not treat public places like they should. But, I'm not really concerned with that. It is not my problem. What I am concerned with is howthe employees act. Now that I'm writing this, I remember having several bad interactions with employees in the past. I had one where a server who told me she was off duty, try to ask me for money. I thought she was just a guest and we were gambling together but after a little time, I noticed a lot of employees seemed to know her. I've never seen her before and I've been here a good amount of times. She finally told me she was a server but she had been asking me to give her money so she can play more with me. I was winning so it wasn't a big deal and I was having fun but thinking back, it seemed kind of shady and possibly planned. I've always had a really bad time with servers bringing drinks here. Every time I pass by the server pit by the bar, I see them just sitting there chatting with each other. I've given up on worrying about drinks even though I pour hundreds of dollars in every night I'm here. It seems pointless to try complaining about that. Most recently, I had an extremely strange thing happen. I put my card in and the little sidescreen pops out saying it recognized me. Suddenly, during a bonus, I looked down and saw someone else's name in the bottom bar. It was my card but somehow someone else's name was there, "Karrin". I thought this was extremely strange especially since this girl had just sat next to me and was talking about jackpots on the machine I was on. When I mentioned the card malfunction, she barely batted an eyelash and said that happens all the time. I've been going here for years and have never seen that happen. Upon retrospect, she seemed really really close with the slot rep there. When he came over to hear the problem about the malfunction, he just started punching the card reader. He didn't even check the card, he just punched it like he knew exactly what was wrong. He was trying to shake out the twisted reader. I mean, how come he didn't even check to see the card was the wrong one? That along with the girl who (strangely looked like a 'karrin' to me), both acted like this was totally normal. I'm not gonna lie, it was so strange that I thought maybe they were a jackpot team or something. I've never hit at a station casino so I wouldn't know but it was so strange there had to be something going on. The fact that part of the weirdness was an employee made me think it was going to be a surprise but almost two weeks now and nothing. 

Someone please tell me what that was about...

I had a great time last night bowling with my daughter and son in law. Bowled at 179, 193, 211. Bowling is only $1 per game on Thursday nights. Bought 2 new bowling balls and a bag for my daughter and son in law. It helped their game. Very friendly and knowledgeable guy.

Greg Turco the hotel manager is a bad  manager he lets his employees basically steal and defends them over a customer I DO NOT recommend this place I have lived in vegas for a long time and have always heard stuff about this place but about a week or so ago my girlfriend and I stayed here and they kept my deposit because I had marijuana on the table that clearly was never smoked. from my understanding in the state of Nevada you are allowed to have marijuana legally I understand you can't smoke just anywhere so I rolled it  to go smoke at my cousins house when we went to check out I had the blunt rolled not smoked yet when they told me I smoked in the room I said no but I do have marijuana on me I showed them the blunt that was not sparked yet.  So if you are a marijuana smoker or have any illnesses for the reason that you need it I would not come here cause they charge you $100 for having something that is legal to have now.i hope this is useful to some people to not get your money taken and basically get called a liar.. very bad customer service
Anytime I need to stay at the hotel, the Texas Station is the place, away from the strip. Vey consistent, and the rooms are nice. Why not 5 stars? To much smoking downstairs.

The Texas is great for family bowling. If you join a league they have excellent discounts. There is a good pro shop were they have balls for newbies and the highly excited experienced. Providing the ball you choose is in stock they will drill your holes on the spot with a short wait.

My very spry 81 year old father and his girlfriend stayed at Texas Station to attend a wedding this past weekend, it was close to the venue so that's why he chose it.. He was EXTREMELY disappointed

1) Parking distance was not close and there was no valet service available to help with bags
2) Upon check-in it was required to leave credit card info. so they could charge an additional $15 per day to make up the bed even though the room was pre-paid 
3) Pool was teeny tiny, no room for adults... There were 6 kids in the water and no accommodation for any additional children/people
4) The food was lousy
5) The staff was mehhhh at best. 

Don't waste your time staying here.

Situated 5 minutes from my auntie's house, this "local" casino offers all the aspects of what you are looking for in a casino, without all the hustle & bustle of a large crowd...

This casino is off the strip 2 minutes up the 95 fwy.  I prefer this place as opposed to others since its more laid back, has decent table stakes, ranging from 5 to 100 dollars per bet, and the cocktail waitresses come by quite often...

In the long run, I'm 50-50 winning here, but thats certainly better than other places I tried to run my money up on...

They also have a good food plaza, video game center, movie theater, and bowling alley...

Take a trip sometime to Texas Station!..

-RR
Tonnie at the bowling alley gave us exceptional service!!! She was great! Thank you very much!!! Very positive experience!!

BLOOD ON MATRESS AND SHEETS
Well, they never found "Marry Merritt" in their employee records (the woman on the invoice to contact for billing inquiries). Accounting didn't return our 3rd call. Yesterday I went to the bank to dispute the charge. My bank, not Texas, reimbursed me for their mistake. I hope they go after them hard!

Thank you, Jonelyn G for posting your experience in the reviews. It is because of you I took my claim to the bank instead of waiting for Texas Station to do nothing. BLOODY MATTRESS AND SHEET in the room?? Ew! Charging my credit card after you give me an invoice with $-14.55, balance due $0... BAD TEXAS STATION!

Played bingo today. Every time I play their is always 1 caller that calls the numbers way to fast. I only play 1 paper pack and she is calling the 2nd number before you can even get halfway thru the pack. Every one complains about it.  I have complained at the counter and all you get is I am sorry.  This has caused me to loss out on bingos because the other number has already been called.

Texas Station is an awful place to stay while in Las Vegas. Shell out the extra one hundred and stay at a more guest-oriented hotel that won't scam you out of money you could be using towards activities.

My family and I went on a trip to Vegas last weekend, and first and foremost, Check-In was a horror. My mom had paid in advance and booked an early check in (something that cost extra, she was charged for it). Upon getting to the front desk, we were told that we could not check in early because there were still guests in the room. We had to wait until regular check in time and still had to pay the fee for a luxury of "early check in" that we did not even receive. Not only that, but the clerk then proceeded to say that my mom's card had been declined, mind you, after she had already paid in full through booking. So short nearly two hundred dollars now, my sister had to pay for the room, deposit and all. More on the money scam later.

My uncle went as well and had also booked in advanced (a non smoking room). His room was not ready upon arrival, and in order to get him out of the way, the clerk stuck him in a random room in an effort to get rid of him and help the next person in line. She put him and his family in a smoking room. With chronic asthma, he could hardly breathe. After hauling his luggage and family back and forth from lobby to smoking room back to lobby, all the clerk said was "All I can say is sorry."

Fast forward to nearly two hours later when the rooming (not the money) situation was sorted out, we find out that there is a limit on towels per room. It's three. Three towels per room, per day. I don't know if anyone knows how difficult it is to have four ladies in a room trying to shower, but three towels is not enough. Speaking of the shower, the bathtub was gross, stained, and the water pressure was bad.

On the day of check out, it was beyond frustrating trying to get downstairs. We waited fifteen minutes for an elevator, because the hotel thought it was a great idea to begin transporting mattresses during peak check out times. We ended up just traveling down four flights of stairs with luggage because it was impossible to get on the only two elevators in the hotel.

Let's talk about more money scams that Texas Station holds. My sister (whom if you don't remember from above, had to pay just about $200 to cover the money the hotel scammed from my mom's card) only received a little over half of the deposit she put in. We left the room in the same condition we found it, and there was no sort of mini bar or anything for extra spending. So where did the rest of the money go? Well, that's something my family has to deal with because of this awful hotel.

We travelled from California, expecting to have a decent place to stay, considering the three star rating. This was such a let down, and I'm disappointed that anybody is running a hotel like this. If you're planning a trip to Las Vegas, do yourself a favor and DO NOT stay at Texas Station.

This place is fun and you can make a little money if you know what your doing. I love the poker room but yesterday I hit the slots up. And it was less stressful than being inside a poker game plus I made a pocket full of change. For those of you who know just how cheap I am you guys know I'm in heaven. Also inside this location we ate at a steak house called Austin it is also five star worthy all by itself. I had chop salad and wine with a nice steak this little spot is really hot and if you take a date their you both will love it. I would not call this place family ready because when I hit a nice place like this the last thing I would like to hear is someone's yelling or crying child. But over all I love Texas Station and  will return as often as I can. I don't play blackjack but when I return I will give it a try.

I went to the sports book to place by bets and the line was very very long. But, I got through it in 8 minutes and made it "just in time" The sports book was very smokey and my clothes reaked. I wish there was a better ventalation system. 

I like the movie theater here. It is huge and plays later-night movies.

I also like the food court. Fat Burger and Dairy Queen are here.

I come to Texas a bit , but not too terribly much! But the way I was treated today when
I had a descripency was 100% professional and very well done.! A place that will be honest with you when you are playing is a great place to play, and they should be applauded as such...THANK YOU TEXAS, You have my business!

Great Place for families, parents get to drink, and kids get to bowl.  Cosmo bowling is cool, make sure you wear white, you glow in the dark.  I have been there quite often, and each time was great.  Pizza, drinks, and good music.

Texas station along with their palace station its what Circus Circus used to be. You pay a resort fee which in itself is Criminal thats supposed to cover the Internet. Internet is spotty at best no matter how many times you call their Internet provider. The TV remote is outdated by 20 years and is complete nightmare to just look at the TV guide. They had me talk to Engineering (Jose B.) Who didnt have a clue what was on the TV remote. This is the quality of staff here. Management needs to step in quick because your guests aren't as stupid as you treat them. The manager was supposed to call me back over the issues hahahaha they dont give a Rats ass. Nice going Station Casinos. This is strike 3 for you guys.

As far as casinos go this one is pretty run of the mill. I do give it high marks for having a variety of stuff to do such as theater, pretty cool bowling alley, and a good variety of places to eat (restaurants, buffet, and fast food). I kind of wish that 3.5 was an option but since it isn't I will round down.

Eek I wasn't too happy with my second stop here. I asked for a bottle of water from one of the casino workers who walks around asking people if they wanted a drink. She said she could get the water but it would probably take a long time and I should just go walk over to the bar if I wanted it quicker. I walked over to the bar and the same casino worker was basically just standing there doing nothing but still couldn't get us the water :/. She told us we'd have to go to the other bar ....Really? You're standing there doing nothing and you can't reach over to get the bottled water to hand to us. Really?

All I wanted was some water...it took me having to ask 3 different casino workers and 2 bars later to get my water.  Yes, people all that for just water.....

Not bad.

Come with no expectation but with open mind.

Breakfast at cafe was quite good.  I was a bit surprised

I never had a problem with Texas Station, as a matter of fact I went there a lot. It's near my place and the movie theater is descent and cheap. I've ate at the buffet and liked it. The biggest problem I have is how they handle vandalism in their parking garages. My dad parked in their parking garage to play on the slots for a couple of hours and came out to his car to find all 4 of his tires slashed. When he went to security they asked him questions like he was the vandal. He was there for about 4 hours waiting to get a tow truck and when he asked security if they could hold the keys so the tow truck driver could pick them up, they refused. The worst part is, Texas Station says he is responsible for the damages. I think they just lost a local regular who plays slots at least twice a week. I will not go there anymore and neither will he or most people we know.

Three enthusiastic stars. Trust me on this. It's straight down the middle of the road, and if you keep your expectations in check, you're going to have a great stay.

This off-the-strip casino and hotel is more than just a bunch of slot machines and hotel rooms; they've got a few things going on that set it apart from lesser properties. Though a far cry (not so very far, but far enough) from the splash and panache of The Strip, there are a few fun additions for the traveler on the budget.

Case in point--a big ol' bowling alley downstairs. A stage in the casino area where a man and his band were belting out some serious rock country. A gift shop. Several restaurants. A food court. And of course, the movie theater. Many, many years ago I ate at Austin's Steakhouse (one of the food options in the casino) and had a tremendous meal. It looks like there haven't been many upgrades since then and the prices have dropped, but to be fair I haven't returned for a meal in years.

The hotel portion is perfectly acceptable. The rooms are comfortable, not giant, but modern enough. The television was a disappointment with less-than stellar control and scratchy reception, but if you're in Vegas and you're watching TV you just might be doing it wrong. The bed was a little rigid, but I slept in spite of it. Though the elaborate sign over the door promised an incredibly fancy "Cardio Room," it actually held 4 machines (one of them broken), packed into a teeny space. I mean, that was just embarrassing. If you're interested in big group meetings or parties, they do cater, and they have a pretty sizable conference wing to the casino with big rooms for your shindig.

Note that when you're booking, you're likely to see some pretty cheap rates advertised. You have to add at least 10 bucks to that for tax, and you'll also add $14 to that for their nonsense "Resort Fee." What is that "Resort Fee," you ask? It's $14 you have to pay. You get to advertise a cheaper rate, then add a fee. It's a gimmick, it's ridiculous, it's stupid. Even with that added price, though, you're still getting a pretty cheap rate.

It's more than just a hotel. Not quite a full-fledged mega-casino. Keep those expectations in line and you'll have a terrific, budget-friendly stay.

We enjoy the breakfast buffet once a month.There is a fair amount of business and sometimes a wait to be seated but never a long wait. 
The selection is very good. The food is better than most buffets and fresher too.
 I particularly like the made to order eggs station. Omelets are delicious.VERY reasonably priced and if you are a rewards member, you often get a two for one buffet so two people can eat for $8. All you can eat. Not a bad deal at all for the quality of food.

They have a great buffet.  My Aunt used to live in Vegas and this is one of the "locals" casinos they always went to.    The place was always clean.   My mom and I did stay there once and the room was nice as well.

This review is for the buffet. Came here last night with the misses for dinner, for the money you can't beat the price. As a local I tend to go to more off the strip properties, the stations are good. Anyways Saturday is BBQ night :)!! 11.99 with my gold card. The brisket was amazing, the ribs were good, bbq chicken was excellent. They have a huge variety of food, the mashed potatoes were very tasty. The desert section was nice as well. I recommend the cheesecake. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because if you get a booth you will kill your back (I'm 5'11) it sits so low it's unbelievable, mine as well sit on the floor. I even saw a lady fall on her face getting out. The idiot who designed this booth must have been 12. NOTE: Get a table your back will thank me later! Last thing you want to do is worry about back spasms while your stuffing your face with brisket

Myself and a group of friends went bowling here last night, and it was a great experience. The customer service was great, and the bowling itself was pretty cheap too. There was 6 of us and in total it was only about $23 so not too shabby compared to other bowling alleys. We came in around 2300 and the lights were off and metal music was playing. Obviously metal music isn't the usual music you'll hear in a bowling alley, but fortunately my friends and I listen to that branch of music so we had a good time. The bowling lane itself seemed a little shorter in comparison to other bowling alleys, but if anything that just made us feel like we were better bowlers lol. This place was definitely a lot better than Santa Fe bowling!
Unfriendly service from all the staff. Our room didn't feel clean or welcoming. There weren't enough blankets on the bed--? Just a sheet. There was a dead spider squished to the wall.

Let me first say the casino is large and we enjoyed the oyster restaurant but that was about it.
1. Booked reservation for King size was told by front desk nope only had 2 queens. Well okay...
2. No newspaper, just no forget we said we give them out to our guesy was promptly directed to gift shop. Well okay...
3. Decide to take a afternoon nap...nope alarm was going off in a hall or a room called 0 no response got hold music, questioned self why i was still in building hung up...
4. I find a lost child bring to front desk,clueless clerk doesn't call room when child gives her the # just questions name on screen doesnt match childs.Easy fix call room?? No call security to ask what to do. So Security guard is thinking for 5 mins...he says well just call the room first... wow that was easy. 
5. 1155pm people next room over are really loud talkers or the walls are thin. Thanks buddy enjoyed his conversation about bathroom problems. Romantic...
6. Rooms a/c unit sounds like it's struggling for air then dies 2am...
7. Beds were very uncomfortable hard on sides bouncy in the middle weird...
8. Oh and when checking in there is a $100 deposit that was a nice surprise....
  Romantic night ruined Never again?

Texas Station is a kind of a hit or miss casino you can't expect a lot it's a bit old, it's a little boring but at the same time it's got good deals on room rates, it's got Station's name under it to boot etc.... I will say this much I lost $200-300 in this place in 1 hour and got myself comp'd 3 rooms ever since and over 500 tier points.. so they def consider this a bit on the higher side of rolling the dice and pulling the slots.. If your in the area travel a bit farther down to Sante Fe Station or if your in the mood to just take a shot at some action at the Texas Station then go for it maybe you'll hit big I know they offer room easy if you give them some play.

This casino is right by my house and I love coming here. Staff is always friendly and there is so plenty you can do from catching movie and dinner to getting some games of bowling in. Never had a bad experience yet!

Affordable. Friendy and Fun!
The rooms are clean and well appointed. Check in was easy and fast.
 The pool was lovely in the early afternoon before it gets hot out there.
Plenty of food options and great steak house and Oyster Bar.

The Casino is clean and hoppin'
Friendy atmosphere. Thanks

I love this place, not sure why but hey it's Texas ;) this is simply my best buffet. They have Mexican, Italian, Asian and American...everything I like. I have always had a great dining experience at the Texas buffet and will be back, time after time!

Remember when you could get a cheap room and cheap food in Las Vegas? You still can as long as you go away from the strip and downtown and head to one of the casino complex in the outskirt! This is just what Texas Station is, old style, good value place.

Nothing fancy but my room was clean, parking was easy and there's a good choice of restaurant and a Starbucks on site. I also used the small pool on my last day here (weather was a bit too cold on first few days of my early April stay).

what surprised me the most was the $100 deposit I had to pay even after paying the entire bill up front!!!!! I asked what was the reason for this and the front desk person said was "oh everyone has to pay the deposit" My room was supposed to be smoke free, but there was a definite remainder of cigarette smoke in the room. The bathroom was so dim, I thought there was a blown light bulb. And last but not least the most annoying thing was the $50 cab ride from the airport. They have no airport shuttle.

There's not a lot to love here, but I've got some serious like for this place.

First of all, I dig the location.  When I go to Las Vegas I want to stay far away from the Strip.  Usually I stay over on Boulder Highway, but every once in a while I like to hit up North Las Vegas.

I have stayed here many times in the past, so I knew what to expect.  Stations properties are fairly standard.  Same basic rooms, few amenities.  I'm cool with that.

This visit I booked my room through Hotels.com.  I booked and paid for a room with a King sized bed.  So, I show up right at the appointed check-in time and they have no rooms with a King sized bed.  I offered to wait and check in later.  The clerk hemmed and hawed and I realized she wasn't going to give up a King bed, so I accepted a room with two double beds.  I got the distinct impression all this was because I booked through Hotels.com instead of directly through the hotel reservation system.

This has happened to me before.  I always respond the exact same way: I refuse to spend another dime in the place.  I will not gamble, nor will I eat in any of their restaurants.  Why should I?  I chose to spend my dough at places that appreciate me as a customer.  

So, even though the room came with a lot of great coupons (like a $5 match play, free Keno ticket, Bingo bonus cards, etc), I didn't bother with them.  No way were these weasels getting any of my cash.

About the actual room: the WiFi was free.  The TV was decent sized and the channel selection was above average for a budget property (had a Keno channel, but no horse racing).  There are no ports for charging anything, but there is an outlet near the bed to plug a charger into.  

The bed was saggy, but not too excessively.  The pillows were the worst thing in the room (other than the absence of a King bed).  Cheap ass super fat foam pillows, perfect to sit on at a football game, but impossible to use for sleep.  I rang up Housekeeping and had them bring me a replacement.  It was just a slightly less thick version of the same cheap ass foam pillow.  If you are contemplating a stay here, I suggest you plan on bringing your own pillow.

The amenities are paltry, but at least they still have soap in bar form.  I hate liquid soap places!

Finally, let me say the room was clean.  Housekeeping here is excellent.  I love that they provide a little envelope to leave a tip for the housekeeper.  

Mikey C says: honor my reservation or lose my business.

Off the strip, really nothing to do around it and about 20mins off the strip. Down stairs in the casino floor there are a couple places to eat, tables, slots, bars, a betting hall and a couple areas that had live bands also had a movie theatre and bowling alley. For the most part everything in the hotel is out dated, uncomfortable bed, and not so great shower pressure. Room service is hit and miss on the time seems like they are working 24/7. Also walls are just about paperthin it seems heard a nice fight outside our hotel room last night. Guess the price was decent. Seems to be a little more of the ghetto folks here

Do not eat at the buffet. The food sits under the lights and gets hard. The Chinese station is the worst. The woman that makes the food, does not make the food like she was trained. I complained about the food to her. she acted as if she didn't understand me. I asked for a manager and she told me no,turned around and processed to place old cold food onto the new food she was trying to cook(since I was complaining) . The mashed potatoes were runny. it's cheap food. LoLo's is a lot better. They have more hospitality.

Austins, Bowling and Movies are all I would go here for.

This is a station casinos property and they all are pretty similar to me. they all smell like smoke. You walk in to the place and it reaks of smoke, and when you leave it stays and lingers on your clothes. 

They have cosmic bowling and great deals if you like to bowl.  You can have birthday parties as well and its inexpensive.  They have a snack shop that serves wings, pizza and hot dogs, and ofcourse soda. My favorite is Shirley Temple. You go over and buy your soda by the pitcher at the snack shop and head over to the bar and get the cherry syrup and cherries.

Going to the movies here is almost like watching movies in the ghetto. They check your bags and treat everyone like hoodlums.. If you are a big bag kinda girl, they will check and make sure you are not smuggling anything in as far as food goes. They want you to spend your money inside thats why. This is the only station casinos theater i know about that checks your bag physically. Geez!

Austin's Steakhouse is similar to Charcoal room at Santa Fe. My favorite , although very simple, is the bacon wrapped jumbo shrimp.. oh so good..

I like coming here to spend time with my mom playing bingo.. overall this place is kid friendly, and family friendly. Oh and they have a Kidsquest for those who have little ones! Just make sure you bring shot records if you're a first time dropping kids off to Kidquest!
