I've been coming to this casino semi-frequently for the past 4 years and here is what I've drawn from my experiences here:

- the slots are notoriously tight...they practically squeek and scream as the reels spin...beware..
- the movie theater is a Regal Cinema(which I like due to their frequent user card program)
- the sports book seems to be the typical set up for a Stations casino...solid, if not spectacular
- last time I was here I won a free buffet during a promotion(review to follow :P) 
- can get a bit smoky but not as bad as some of the other locals spots I've been to
- the casino in general is pretty clean, much better than the Fiesta across the street
- the service by the employees is strictly a crap shoot, ranging from nice to downright surley and bitter

Nowadays, its a place I might catch a movie if the time works best for me that given day. So 3 stars is about right. Not the best, not the worst...just somewhere right in the middle.

I just recently relocated to Vegas and found Texas Station to be close to home. I have stopped by a few times and played video poker at the bar. Marty is the best bartender ever! He knows all the locals that come in by name and knowing I am new to the area, he has introduced me to others. It is nice to feel welcome in a new city!

My family and I ate at the buffet 11 people was very unhappy with the hostesses we was celebrating a birthday after spending over 200$ which we had 5 on one check 6 on another wanted to sit next to each other it was not busy two tables next to each other was fine but because we didn't want to pay a automatic gratuity the hostess made it her point to seat us on opposite sides of a empty room. We are all in the casino industry cocktail server, a dealer and a Director in our party. We paid the automatic gratuity and she then said oh you can go sit next to your family. I then asked for them to put the tables together to accommodate us. We will never return because she was so busy hustling for the server. I would've tip well over the automatic gratuity..

It's one of the older casinos so there's stuff outdated and what not. The food court is continuously taking and putting new food in the food court. The movies are cheap, and theaters are okay, I just wish they did a better job with not letting minors sneak into rated R movies. I went and saw IT tonight and there were like 8 year olds in there who made it quite hard to watch the movie.

This station casino does not care for its neighbors or community.  They book parking lot events that play music loud enough to shake my front door and hear in a well enclosed Walmart.  Called the property and they sent me to security -- they said there was nothing I could do because it was private property... he didn't even care to listen to my recommendation of putting noise restrictions in future contracts.  Called the police 311 and they said the complaint was already created, the police dispatched, and they said they would be done at 7pm (and they were going to do nothing).

Casino only review I liked it it's huge ! My sister lost her ID and they called her so fast to security because they found  it ! I lost that night but thank you stranger for finding it ! It's a nice and clean and attentive casino

Living close by to this Casino, and coming by after work to gamble, I find this place to be interesting. 

Staying with the Texas theme, the outside looks amazing, and very well kept in shape. I would probably say, if it was located in a nicer place, it probably would be better in many ways. But the fact that its located on Rancho and not a good place  for that matter, it has its wear and tear that really shows. 

Most of the time, I go their with the wife to see a movie. The theater itself is located next to the food court, which is nice. But once inside, their concession stand seem to be a small area and not very well put. They do have a concession stand upstairs, but rarely open. I like the fact that the casino has two different levels, where they have more theaters. But it probably can be cleaner. 

Restaurants, Food courts, and Starbucks, of course, I have mix reviews on that. Starbucks, there are a few Batista's there that I like. But one of them didn't really get my order right. Even though I did drink it, cause I needed coffee in my system, it sure didn't go well with my stomach. I'm lactose intolerant, so I ordered soy milk with no whip. Its kind of pointless to ask for soy milk, when you put on the whip. Now whenever I pass by that Starbucks, I make sure its not with that one Batista, who puts whip with soy milk. Feast Buffet, I had a review on lack of cleanliness and lack of service. But the food and dessert was great. The food court, I don't like the fact that some of these places don't open till 11am. But their choice in restaurants is decent.  The only place open 24 hours is Fat Burger, which, I don't think its that great. Customer service is nice, but food is kind of lousy. 

I like the fact that they have a bowling center which was nice to bowl here and there. Its been a while, so I really enjoyed bowling. Its a nice place, but probably could be better. But the fact that they have a bowling center is good enough for me. 

The Convention Center, I went there for my wife's Christmas party, The place look really nice, and very roomy. Very clean, and really like the professionalism of the staff.   If I ever had a big gathering, I probably would have it here. 

As far as gambling goes, I would say I'm probably one of their regulars, so they know me very well. But I would have to say, from the first time I step foot in the gambling area, people were nice, and the waitress were nice. They at least talk, and know what their doing, most of the time. The waitress tend to make sure we're okay on drinks. 

Over all, its a decent place to be at. It has its ups and downs. I wouldn't expect much out of it, but just enough to be satisfied on being there.

We used to stay at Texas Station all the time when we came to town, but we haven't so in a while.  The hotel is fairly nice, the gift shop is nice, but we decided to stay at Sam's Town once, and we were sold after that.  I like to play blackjack and there aren't that many active tables sometimes.  My husband likes to play video poker and there weren't many machines that he liked either, but we went this month, and enjoyed our visit more.  Perhaps we'll go next time we're in town.  They have a movie theater (which we've never been to) and restaurants, etc.  It's a good place that locals frequent.  We used to also visit the buffet but the line is always pretty long now when we go.

So the hotel & casino are nice. Don't expect to be able to get much reception to your cell phone in here though, if you have ATT or Sprint. 

The hotel room was pretty roomy, but I was really disappointed by the fact that there was no comforter/bigger blanket on the beds. It was just a sheet, thin blanket and top sheet. The bed wasn't bad though, I slept alright no aches or pains to complain about. The television is extremely outdated, but we didn't watch it anyway. 

I think the waitresses in the hotel could have better/sexier uniforms. Personally, they were more of an eye sore than a person I wanted to purchase a drink from. 

The resort fee that you have to pay after you check out is pretty ridiculous to me. Why should you have to pay for things they advertise as "complementary"? 

My boyfriend and I stayed for two nights for a wedding. The reception area was beautiful and the catering was amazing. That was the best part of our stay.

The bowling alley downstairs is pretty cool and fairly priced. Although, the snack bar is a little pricey and when my boyfriend went to order a soft pretzel, the guy told him it was a 5 minute wait. Instead, we waited 20 minutes for a burnt pretzel. 

As far as food goes, the Grand Cafe has great food but we realized that we could have eaten at the buffet for a lot cheaper. There was a pamphlet advertising Room Service but another guest that stayed the same time as us were told that they don't deliver the food to the rooms. So much for ROOM service, hah.

Next time I visit Vegas, I will be staying somewhere else. 


P.S. If you plan on having a wedding reception here, they charge you a ridiculous amount for champagne. If you bring your own champagne, there is a $9 fee per bottle opened.

Good lord, I thought this was a hotel, not a white trash penal colony.  Well, ok, in all fairness, it is not just a white trash penal colony, because it is full of trash of all races, creeds, and colors.  

But, in complete honesty, if the human race had a trash can, it would be this dump.  

I am, right now, in a "non smoking" room, that smells like the rugs were shampooed with chewing tobacco.   Or, maybe I just smell it from the next room, because the walls are so thin that you can hear a dog fart through them.  

Walking through the lobby, it looks like a frigging zombie movie.  That movie "Leaving Las Vegas" should have been filmed here, because being here makes ME want to drink myself to death with a hooker.  

There are two reasons to stay here:  1)  There is a blizzard coming, it is unsafe to be outside, and you are on foot, with no shoes, and you'll die before you get to other shelter, 2) you're trash and you want to be with the other trash.  

Holy crap.  Get me out of this frigging dump.

Texas Station!! Yeeehaaa! Or Nah.. So I was literally dragged to come down to this place last night. Most definitely not my kind of scene however my friend had some FREE PLAY and food comps that they insisted on sharing with me. We all love free stuff right? Well what's that rule about you get what you pay for? I'm the first to admit I am extremely spoiled when it comes to being an MLIFE member (Platinum). I DO NOT gamble anywhere else besides my lovely MGM properties (Some of them). 

This place is great for locals who live in the area and or just don't like to play down on the strip with the big dogs! Whoot Whoot! Is this casino a classic? Sure... Depends on what you classify as classic because it's for sure not classy. Neighborhood is a bit sketchy but they have security..I think.. Anyways it is a bit dated inside and when we were playing I just noticed that the employee's all seemed to hate their jobs. That slogan that they run about "We Love Locals" seems a bit contradicting. As we played a few games of blackjack at different tables, there was just no sense of personality from the dealers. Weird. I decided to get up and go play some slots! Boy are they TIGHT! I thought the WYNN was bad ha-ha! There were plenty of Cocktail waitress's working. They seemed to be a lot more friendly and pleasant to deal with. I only ended up ordering one drink since the premium liquor I'm used to wasn't offered. The vodka that they used in my Vodka tonic was awful might've been rubbing alcohol? My throat get's itchy from cheap liquor.. Don't expect anything that normally comes in a fancy glass to come as normal here. You get a tiny probably 6-8oz glass full with ice and about 3 ounces of liquor. Okay this was my que to go! My friend starting wining so of course we stayed a bit longer. Try the 99 cent Margaritas they offer. Not much alcohol but you can pretend there is plenty mixed in or just grab your flask from the car and add in your own Vodka like I did :-) All in all not sure if I'd be back.

Decided to give tis place a try ..since palace station was mostly being renovated at tis time...arrived on a tues moring..place looked dead about 15 cars parked out front...ck into our room was suprised was like newly remodel..clean and great service from front desk...but in evening the place was booming wit pp...prob more locals....but usualy more busy on wkends ...

Checked in here a few times - guess it's time for a review.

It's a Station Casino property. As it's not the Red Rock, you can pretty much know that it's more geared for the locals. 

The casino never seems to be busy like the strip properties which is nice as I don't like walking around like a herd of cattle. That translates to ample parking considering they have a few parking structures. There's the usual bars, clubs and places to eat - including a food court but what's also nice is that there's a theater there. There may be other amenities but I'm usually here to eat.

I have always stayed at the Texas casino for years  I stayed for new years  Last year this year we stayed for Christmas check in Friday morning check out Monday the 25th I come out in my car is stolen We let security know and all they can say is we're sorry and total nocarva cops and they say they can't because the police can go into private property I think is bull Talk to the manager friend ask and they came to nothing and thus a security issue and are they can save their sorry I am where from my lay some think about a how do we do it to come back home We stayed with them for so many years wasted so much money and are they can say is we're sorry Report the weather's a lot of camera so lot of security going up-and-down but the securities just kicking back in the back text I

Did I really rate this place 2 stars?  Barely.

First, the good...I'm a local and place a lot of sports bets here.  Better odd's can be found in sportbooks off the strip, but this place is close to home for me.  For those on the "cheap", they have $1 dogs and $1 Buds during any NFL game.  $1 margarita's can be had at any hour.  I also see most of my movies at the Regal here...they have 18 clean theaters.  Fatburger is open 24 hours.  Lobster at the Oyster Bar is good.  Bowling is a bargain.  Like most Station haunts, there are various "Swipe & Win" events throughout the year.

The bad...the southern parking lot and surrounding hotel rooms on the property stink!  There's been a sewage clog at the intersection of Rancho Drive & Coran Lane since at least 2009.  I find their food court better than any restaurant.  There you'll find a Fatburger, Baja Fresh, Sbarro, and Panda Express.  The Feast Buffet sucks, unless you like salty food.  I only eat there when I've won a free buffet & I know what's edible from trial and error.  Pasta Cucina & Austin's Steakhouse will disappoint (if you're craving steak, Ron's at AZ Charlie's is worth the short drive).  The Grand Café is marginal at best and on a downward slide (still good for breakfast though).  The staff throughout is hit & miss.  Most hate their jobs, especially the cocktail servers.  Most of the dealer's are Asian with no personality...but, a couple are quite friendly and easy to find (hint:  You won't find them at the craps table).  Slots are tight.  Overall, this place is a giant step down from the likes of Red Rock, Green Valley Ranch and Aliante.

*Update Dec 2014

Still 2 stars at BEST!

Bud bottles during NFL football games have increased from $1 to $2 ea...still not a bad deal, but the servers here are some of the worst in Vegas.  Hot dogs are still $1, but they put out a lot less condiments now.  Grumpy Marty (from the satirical "We Love Locals" commercials) no longer works the sportsbook bar and is not missed in the least.  I've sat at machines at least at least 100 times here and can count on one hand how many times a cocktail server has offered me a drink (no joke).  Sbarro has been replaced with a single slice pizza joint.

We had a king room and it was on the older side but comfortable and clean (older decor rooms are not unusual in Vegas especially hotels offering low room rates) This hotel/casino is considered to be a "locals" place. It is not in a very good section of North Las Vegas and is not near the strip (about a 20/30 minute car ride). The casino is big and has a pleasant feel.  I felt they had a great mix of games. Unfortunately the employees that we encountered throughout this property (in under 24 hours)were not happy employees.  They don't want to be there and are very unhappy with bad attitudes. For instance;
- we stopped at one of the casino floor bars and the bartender was so miserable and  it was so evident he was angry. I was taken back and really just wanted to move on but we ordered drinks and he slammed them in front of us and loudly complained about the  things bothering him especially the TV that wasn't working. We left and went to another casino bar and found another miserable bartender.They both did their job but they were clearly miserable employees but that seems to be the theme here all except the lady who checked us in but she too could not smile. - Went to the cafe and waited 20 minutes and no one acknowledged us and was ready to leave until a lady said she couldn't take us waiting another minute and took our order. (I believe she was the beverage server). 
-No cocktail service by the food court casino area. People were annoyed. Finally one comes by but you had to see her and flag her down because she wasn't stopping.  She  took our order and we waited over 20 more minutes for her to get back.
- One slot machine was beeping for so long and loud needing paper that we could not take the noise anymore so we left the area twice.  This happened 3 times and the third time one lazy slow miserable sad faced slot attendant asked 'US' which machine it was making the noise LOL!!
- We did not have a do not disturb sign for our room so we asked the cleaning lady. She said it's behind the door, we said no its not there so she angrily gave us one.
-Checkout is at 12PM and we had someone pounding on our door at 11:45.

  I can only imagine the poor service you will get during the week because this was on a Saturday (and it wasn't crowded, gee I wonder why).  So sad because I really liked the casino. Low employee moral is a sign of poor management and/or company troubles to come. Too much competition wanting my business.... I will never return.

I just moved to Vegas and this was where my fiancée and I decided our first dining experience should be. Me being from Texas, I was awestruck at the lights of the casino and the amount of games available. We purchased a member card, which gave us a discount on the buffet. It was a good selection of food, although the taste was just ok. I will be back though for the games and the bowling. Our waitress was pleasant and very attentive.

Definitely not a 3-star hotel. Barely a 2-star hotel based on my other multiple experiences staying in Vegas... Quite disappointed at the room cleanliness, quality of furniture, location. Everything looks old and depressing.
they have the best buffet in town... i just dont get why i would pay $30 to go into another buffet when i have texas! :D

This review does not include the hotel, because I've never stayed there.
Regarding locals' casinos, Texas Station is right in the middle (hence 3 stars). 
It's huge. I went in through the north side, and when I headed south, I just kept walking and walking. If you want to inject exercise into your gambling then this the casino to do it.
Heading from the north to south, there's a food court, restrooms (very clean), and movie theaters. There are 5 or 6 bars throughout the casino, and I've never seen them very crowded. 
They have a steakhouse and oyster bar on the left (I'll write reviews for them in a couple of days). 
They have a pretty big sports book.
There's also a stage, which has small bands playing on the weekends.
There buffet is so-so. 
They also have a bingo room.
When you reach the south side of the casino, there's the gift shop. 
By the way, the slots are on the north and south ends, and the table games are in the middle, in case you feel like gambling. 
But, the casino is more smoky than average. It's probably because the carpet and ventilation system are old. 
There aren't enough cocktail servers, so it takes a long time for them to get around to you.
That's about it. Hopefully you won't get lost.

This is a really nice place to go eat at the buffet...but I really had a very uncomfortable situation with one of the people that go up to you ask if you want for drinks when playing the slots. I was enjoying time with my family for almost 4 hours of playing. My family member ask for a bottle water from those ladies that come up to you. So I went and ask for a bottle of water. This what she said very rude manner " where are you sitting are you playing if not I won't give any water". I thought she was playing with me, since she seen my family playing. But no she didn't give a damn I was really surprise. This young lady works by the Buffet area she's small and very curvy and caucasian in the casino slots. Very disrespectful person, didn't get her name but I was there between 2 to 3 pm on January 5 2016..hope you don't get her attitude. 
That's my rating hope a manager can see this never I will recomendamos anyone to this place sorry but really bad service..big loss.

There's not really much I can say about Texas Station and have it cover everything and/or be 100% accurate. It is a very off-the-strip casino. 
What I can really speak for is more or less the hotel experience, what I have witnessed in the casino area and the food.  

My boyfriend and I have been in Texas Station Gambling Hall staying in their hotel for about a week, going on a week and a half. Overall, the atmosphere is "okay". Nothing in Texas Station really stands out, though if you do love the 'gambling-night-scene' you won't be let down.

The food here is really so-so. I'm going to have separate reviews for the places I have actually visited and eaten at, but it is all a little overpriced. If you want real food, visit the food court which has Fatburger (open 24/7), Baja Fresh, Sbarro, and Panda Express - otherwise, you have The Grand Café, Feast Buffet, Pasta Cucina and Austin's Steakhouse; this is not including the tiny, and horribly run, diner on the lower level of the casino where the Bowling area is. Oh, and they also have a Starbucks!

The people here are also so-so. There are ladies walking around in red velvet dresses that seem so droll I almost want to give them money to take a taxi home - that or give them an application they can fill out to get them a new job that they love. They basically wander around aimlessly, looking bored, annoyed and just unfriendly. I have yet to see one that looks at me in a kind manner! I'm assuming they are walking around to take bar orders for people like myself and tidy up the machines? Either way, they don't set the mood in the place at all.

The hotel portion of Texas Station ... actually isn't bad at all. Skimming through other reviews, a few people mentioned "eh" hotel rooms. Our room was actually quite nice! At the price it is per day, it's not bad at all. The only drawback is that you have to pay for your wifi PER DEVICE, which is $6 a device each day, and on top of that, if you need a fridge they will provide you one but it is $10 a day. 
Here, it seems the rooms tend to come with two beds - ours were full sized and very plush. They were definitely great beds to sleep in, super comfortable. Every room has its own AC Unit that is adjustable by the thermostat on the wall. You have to put your bedroom key card in the wall where it is illuminated by green LEDs for the AC to actually stay on.

The room service is good, but seriously annoying. DO NOT plan on sleeping in unless you have your 'do not disturb' sign on your door. They will generally come to your room around 9am-ish and they do this strange, silently knock two times and then enter routine while saying "Hellloooo?". Ugh.
They tidy up very well, though, I will give them that. Also the TVs in the rooms are flippin' awesome. We got a 25-30" flat screen in ours with decent quality picture. 

Over all, not a whole lot of complaints. $1 mediocre margaritas, conference rooms and party rooms as well as a wedding chapel area, a nice movie theater, plenty of good places to eat, $3 blackjack,  tons of slot machines scattered everywhere, a lovely and quaint gift shop, Texas Station rewards (get it!), clean hotel rooms. Worth three stars. A-Okay it is!

Rating for buffet only:

Cheap buffet with the member card, but the food itself is nothing impressive. Lots of variety and options, including everything from gumbo and jambalaya to panda-express style stir fry to tacos al pastor cooked to order to pizza and BBQ. Meat is usually dry (unless cut on the spot), and most dishes are on the bland side. I would recommend the fish, mashed potatoes, broccoli calzone, and biscuits and gravy. 

Many items were cold initially, but I later noticed they had warmed up. I'm not sure why, but it might be worth asking staff (who is polite and readily available) to warm something up. 

The casino/playing floor itself is distinctly thick with the smell of smoke, but the buffet area doesn't smell at all. Besides the smoke, there is no suggestive or pornographic advertising inside or out, which makes it relatively family friendly.

My fiance & I stopped in here to check on rates for people coming to our wedding from out of state. Trish, the lady at the front desk, was very nice & suggested we talk to the group rates folks. Regina, the sales coordinator, put us together with Li'Shey, the sales director. She asked the right questions, made suggestions for things that we hadn't thought of & even took the time to show us a room. We ended up doing a contraxt for a block of rooms for great prices at 2 locations so our guests will have a choice. She has a wall of recognition from all sorts of people, the Thunderbirds & a Women of Distinction award; very impressive! Both ladies were so friendly & helpful! 

The only thing that kept me from giving 5 stars was the location & decor. They can't do anything about the location, but a renovation sometime in the not too distant future wouldn't hurt.
Non smoking rooms still smell of smoke. Water shut off for an entire day. Furniture is outdated. Buffet food could have been better.

My husband and I went here for the buffet because he had good memories of one other time he tried the buffet YEARS ago with his family.

Well, on our current trip I must say that this place sucked so bad that I don't know where to start.  I know, I'll start with the unhealthy, thick, life-stealing smoke in the casino that you have to walk through on your way to the buffet.  

Oh, and then there are the depressing living dead looking people that you have to pass by who are wasting their time and money on the slot machines.  I mean, these people look SAD!!

And my prize for taking the long walk through the joyless smokey haze?  Bland, uninspired, cheap quality, worst buffet food I have ever had.  This crap was so colorless and pathetic that I found it hard to believe that my husband could have ever eaten decent food here before.  What a waste of money and, more importantly, minutes from my life.  I get the heebie-jeebies just remembering it.  Talk about a bad dream that I never want to have again!

Pleasant room, quiet inside, noisy in hall.  They had no record of my prepaid reservation.  Fortunately I brought a printed copy and I had to wait 15 minutes for them to recreate the reservation.  I asked for upgrade room or casino dollars as compensation for their error - got nothing.  Casino perks with players card are miniscule - I got $3 free slot play.  I had the breakfast buffet for $5.99 which was good.  There is no free internet "at all" - though expedia had shown free internet "limited".  There are two levels $5.99 or $12.99 a day.  Low room fee but everything is upcharge, upsell.  You have to sign an agreement and initial a dozen section with different rules.  Would not stay at again.  Waiting to be sure I get my deposit back and don't get charged twice for room.  NOTE:  $14.95 resort fee per day in addition to room charge.
Machines are so tight, the only way to leave there with money is to rob them. I will not go back. I am local, and this is the only place that you have a 99% chance of loosing.

I was not expect too much about Texas station since I booked it cheap but come on!!! At least be friendly and smile. We drive a long distance and we are tired too.
The front desk, black lady, she yawn more than 6 times in front of my face and the breath is not smell good either.
At check in, I have to pay $100 for deposit, WTF, if I know the hotel have deposit, no way I come. I feel secured when I cash in my pocket. The check in lady did not bother explain the rules and just gave it to me to read it. WOW worst customer service ever.
The food was fair and cheap, parking is good since at 1AM in morning and it is only 24 car around.
At morning, When I ask to extend 1 more day, they charge me for $60 total which I only pay half price include tax and hotel fee last night. With $60, I can go to strip and rent better hotel and better service.
addition, It was so cold in room even I turn the heat to 83 and when I call for the front desk ask for more blanket., Never see the blanket or anyone call back
conclusion, worst hotel ever in Vegas. I think Motel 6 is much better. I certain that I will never come back. I regret to spent time in that hotel and waste my value time in Vegas
The interior looks like Boulder Station, but with a different floor plan.  I had some Mexican dude asking me for a dollar as I was leaving.  Crappy!

I've gone bowling here.
I've seen movies here. (The Peanuts Movie)
I've been to conferences associated with work here.
I have only played at one table game since moving to Las Vegas in 2005.
(Roulette at Texas Station)
I went to a concert here. (Doobie Brothers)
The Feast Buffet at Texas Station is one of my favorites in the city.
My wife and I were married here !!

Something for everyone !

Once upon a time I enjoyed coming to this place to watch movies, hang with friends at the lounge watching Love Shack perform, and enjoying a drink or two at the casino bars.  That was when Seinfeld & Friends were dominating the ratings on TV.  

I recently visited the property and it's lost it's fun atmosphere and energy.  The crowd has changed a lot since those glory days and the casino is just depressingly empty.  It didn't make me want to stay and hangout....at least I have some great memories from the good times.  Maybe it will get better when the economy rebounds?

Return Factor - 5%

texas station's customer service has been nothing short of a nightmare. I honestly wish that I could cancel my reservation on the spot and take my fund elsewhere. For starters, the system for reservations is absurd. I've been traveling alone since my teenage years, even worked for a hotel or two & NEVER have I EVER known a policy that requires THREE deposits to modify an existing reservation. Initially, I called in reference to modifying a reservation & and even though it made ZERO sense to me, I obliged. I then experienced an unfortunate & untimely passing of my relative, which required me to adjust my check in date, as my flight will have me arriving in town after the 2nd (flight arrives at 12:35am) ..... I called to have my reservation adjusted and was flat out DENIED (even though I called well over 24 hrs in advance) and have been given the runaround and HORRIBLE customer service since Sunday evening. I've left messages for multiple managers at the front desk, only to NOT have ANY of my messages returned. I have dealt with extremely rude people placing me on extended hold times, only to be forwarded to a voicemail & be forced to "wait" for someone to call me back. I was told last night, after calling and trying to have the matter handled all day, that management was supposed to be in touch, and today after the funeral, I called & was told at 12:30 that after someone was off their phone call, I would be called. It is now 6pm central, still no follow up contact nor, was an email of any kind sent. 

This is not only a disgusting display of a lack of compassion & empathy for your "guests" but this is a clear slap in the face to someone who did NOT have to book with you, as well as the wedding block that is utilizing the facilities. I will absolutely NEVER come back and I haven't even checked in yet. I will be taking this review to all the hotel sites that I see your establishment on.

Rude service! Why would a bartender be rude when they live for tip money? I asked the bartender for a specific beer and he said "NO!" I asked "please?" He said no again. After a minute he finally told me they didn't have the beer brand that I ordered. He could have just said that in the first place! Talk about being absolutely rude!

Along with the Fiesta Rancho located directly across the street, this is the closest locals casino in my neck of the woods in the badlands of the greater Las Vegas metropolitan area located near and beyond the North Las Vegas Airport.

Since opening in 1995, this casino has always had a real nice 24-hour poker room where the action never really stopped, but it sadly closed in 2014. All good things must come to an end.

There have been several sequential additions to the much smaller original Texas Station over the years. A large self-serve food court and a multiscreen cinema are now available as are the obligatory coffee shop and a very large buffet with a nearly endless variety of delectable edibles and deserts that change on a daily basis. 

Austin's Steakhouse is worth a visit for more upscale dining as is the Oyster Bar for seafood lovers (discount coupons for both are frequently available).

Various casino promotions/contests run throughout the year with the majority - but not all - related to slot or poker machine play.

If you should find yourself here, don't forget to cross Lake Mead Boulevard and check out the Fiesta Casino, the sister property next door. This casino's smaller overall footprint makes for a more homey atmosphere overall and is preferred by quite a few locals.

Woke up this morning refreshed. The beds here are very comfortable. Our room is clean and smells fresh. We are on the 5th floor and have a strip view, which is nice. Know what you are paying for when you choose this hotel.

It's not a 500.00 dollar per night room. Don't expect the Aria or Wynn. But for the price it's a great deal. Clean rooms, good play selection in the casino and very delicious food. You're not going to be disappointed as long as you're expecting a mid range room.

The station casinos get a bad rep, but I think they get a bad rep because people are expecting a 500.00 dollar room for 75-80 dollars.

I recommend this hotel

This review is for their Oyster Bar which is one of the best, to me, in the city.
Very good and the staff is always helpful.. Im def going to be a regular here!
If I could give zero stars would. Absolute garbage hotel. Incompetent staff, lies and mistakes, and the whole place reeked of something.
This is another stations gem. This company has clean casinos with a lot of food court options, restaurant options and great drink specials. The stations love locals!

Just here for a boxing match for my company cerveza tecate. The room was nice. Bed was comfortable, could see all of the las Vegas strip from my 6th story room window. This place has a bowling alley and its own movie theaters. Was only here for 19 hrs but had fun.

*** This review is for the casino only ***

It has been more than 10 years since I've been here and it looked the same last night as it did 10 years ago.

The casino was not smoky which was a pleasant surprise.  The garage on the north side made access to the restaurant easy.

We came here from wa state, first off there was gum under all our night stands, we found blood on the window seal, dirty floors, front desk service was rude! The halls smell horrible! The cocktail waitresses are vary rude here as well! We will never be coming back here again! Nasty nasty!!

the two people at the bowling lanes snack bar really need help. They are working their butts off trying to keep up with this long line. Why would management schedule only two people to work on a Saturday night?

Probably my favorite casino in Vegas because they offer everything I love.  Note I am trying to eat a lot more healthy now.  But not long ago I used to love to go here and eat at there buffet and food court.  Buffet is great and huge with all the stations you want (bbq, Chinese, salad bar, Mexican etc.) and everything was fresh and tasty.  Food court is A+ with Fatburger, Sabros, Baja Fresh, DQ and Panda Express.  They have good restaurants, bars and a night club that looks like its hopping on the weekends.  There is no other theater around so they show, basically, every movie that is playing in Vegas.  I have seen way more movies there than any place else and i cant say I have ever had a bad time (other than seeing some crap movies).  And if you are eating right I recommend the fish taco's at Baja Fresh!

So very disappointed with this casino. I love coming and playing here, I love that they have a kids quest because I sometimes take my son when we come into town. Me and the fiancée have stayed here before and its our favorite off the strip casino. So we decided to stay here again!.... but OH MY GOSH!!! HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE SERVICE. My fiancées grandmother booked us the room, since she had a few comps and discounts available. She reserved us 2 rooms for this trip, one under her name and one under his, IN CASE something went wrong with either one. 

First off, there's only one person behind the front desk. ONE!!! its Thursday night, I'm sure there's enough people checking in and calling for there to be at least 2 ppl working, but nope! only one. so we waited and waited while she answered calls back to back and TRIED checking ppl in. Seemed like there was an issue with another family not being able to check in to there 3 rooms and they were waiting on management. 

Then we walk up, we give her our info, then she says she cant find anything! As were trying to find out whats going on, she starts talking to the other family about there issue! talk about rude!! then she just simply says "there's nothing here for you"  my fiancée is trying to explain to her, that this room was booked way in advance under his and his Grandmothers name, again she says "I have nothing here for you" with this plain stupid look on her face, with no sense of talking to use, trynna figure out what went wrong. Then, she calls mngmt to talk to them about the other family. As shes going back and forth with 2 conversations, she starts giving us attitude, like if shes the one upset and were being a hassle for her!! UHM NO! we've had a 5 hr drive, were trynna get settled in and were welcomed by ONE RUDE front desk clerk...I think we should be upset....yet, were not!! at least not yet!! she starts talking to my fiancée and hands him over his ID and just says "I cant find anything" we tell her it has to be a mistake....she says"im not talking to you, im on the phone" ....uhm ok! then she says "is there anything else I can do for you?" we stay quiet because SHES on the PHONE.... then she gets upset and repeats herself, so my fiancée asks her "who are youi talking to?" she answers back with "well you! " WTF??!! and she tells us if we wanna stay there for 3 nights it will be $293 with $100 deposit....with our reservation it would of been $150. NO THANKS!!!.

Grandma calls to find out what happened  apparently front desk clerk says that somehow one reservation was cancelled and the other was made for JAN.20th instead of Feb.20th. !!! 

with the poor RUDE service we got and seeing how there was only one person juggling ppl and phones I can guarantee you it was there fault for not paying attention. You cant be on the phone and trynna help someone face to face with 2 different things. Because then you get situations like this!! ...... 

Whats worse..is they tried to accommodate us...long after we were already gone...and checked into another hotel.

Today my family and I went to the buffet. We hadn't been there since 2016, as a family! We really enjoyed it. The fried chicken was so bomb! I smothered mine in brown gravy. I also had a carne asada taco with an orange colored salas. Bomb as well it wasn't spicy at all. I had fresh fruit, raspberry sherbet and sugar free cheesecake... The customer service was excellent and fast. Friendly atmosphere. I highly recommend, oh the price was 11.99 for brunch going into lunch. Of course it'll be cheaper if you use your rewards poi

THE WORST! Total scam of a cheap hotel. Bad everything as far as the actual hotel goes: horrible bedding, thin walls, one towel. . . even the toilet sucked. If you are forced to go to Las Vegas- something I wouldn't wish on my worst enemy- don't stay here. There are plenty of other hotels in this price range & I would bet any of them would be better than this lit up cardboard box.

This was not a good experience and would warn everyone it's only worth $75. per night.  The first night there, we discovered bugs in the room, unfortunately we didn't realize they were all over till after 12:00 am.  The next day we promptly went and complained.  We were given a new room (not an upgrade) and two buffet tickets.  On the upside the buffet was good and there is a Starbucks on site.  All in all the room is functional at very best.

I don't gamble but I live in Las Vegas (my mom moved us here 20 years ago). We come here mainly for the movie theater and the restaurants/food court- Baja Fresh (love this place- a discount is given to movie patrons), Panda Express, Fatburger, Starbucks, Dairy Queen, Sbarro (been to the buffet a long time ago, when this property first opened). I went to the club (tiny and crowded) a few times- also, a long time ago- in the beginning- Love Shack performed here (jeez, seems so long ago; don't know if they are still around). 

Surprisingly, in general, the casino itself is not very smoky to me, unlike many downtown properties (love that because- I'm not a smoker, and I don't want it sticking to my clothes, either). It's also not ghetto, either; lots of families come here. This is a locals' casino. There are two parking garages, as well as a parking lot in front. Head to the parking garage in the back for easy access ( ie. a shorter walk) to the movie theater (less crowded too).  Western theme with general casino design (no clocks inside, dim inside, no clear glass windows for fresh views to the outside).
Really cool casino in North Vegas. Meant to look like a train station. They do get some nice shows there from time to time.

Took the girls here for bowling ! We had a blast. Texas station has a lot of things for familes to do together. And alot of food options. The people there are fairly nice. It convenient and cheap. Lot of teens there so be prepared.

My review is mostly for the buffet, which at $12.99 for the Mother's Day lunch was outstanding.  My friends and I read about this spot in a web site long ago and so when we have a car, we make the trek out to this locals' place where you basically get a great buffet for 1/2 the price of the strip.  Great selection, fajita/quesadilla made-to-order guy, ribs, chicken, garlic bread, excellent chocolate cream pie.  Usually, they have a great chili bar but didn't this time.  Nice drink refilling.  Clean bathrooms.

If you find yourself in North Las Vegas this isn't a bad place to go, I wouldn't make a special trip from Las Vegas. This is more geared for locals, that being said, they have a wide range of restaurants, slot machines and table games with low limits always a plus. Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

Announcement; 38 REVIEWS ARE NOT RECCOMENDED FOR YOU NOT TO READ! besides all the UGLY, NASTY And the UN PLEASANTS REVIEWS? Oh My HIGHER MANAGEMENT PEOPLE OF STATION CASINO? what can  you do about this Place? We ate in the Buffet here twice now and the FOOD ARE FISHY AND UNCOOKED... I experienced stomach ached after I ate the CAJUN LINK or CAJUN Sausage. It was a good Sausage but they cook it rare. And the pork hock are still tough? You need to chew it FOREVER before you swallow it. It is so disguisting. The cooks came there just to work and make money, they doesn't apply the LOVE OF COOKING. it's so sad because the FOOD will go to trash instead of enjoying the tasty food. Most of the FOOD in The BUFFET are not good. What a waste. I don't think they make money o  this place? No more coming back. Please give your food to the Unfortunate People not to the Paying Customer

OMG THE Texas buffet has a BBQ night for $11.99 with player card . 
   I was so excited to hear about this because it close to my home. We usually go to Boulder Station Casino Buffet Friday- Saturday for rib night THAT IS WAY WAY WAY WAY WAY  BETTER . 
Our First Clue At the Texas buffet there was no line at 6:00pm . But we payed to get in $11.99 each two of us.  Ok went to the BBQ station The brisket was dry, cold and over cook , in put bbq sauce on it cut a small pcs. Sooooooo hard dry . I was so disappointed, ribs did have flavor but not falling off the bone, like the ones at Boulder Station 
So don't waste your time or MONEY!!!!!!!!!!!!

Older casino with perma cigarette smoke, but great selection of video poker as well as slots and table games.  The main bar is great, some very good beers on tap and excellent bartenders.  Great venue for a rock show too.  Brutal to get a taxi from after the show however!  I doubt I'd ever stay here due to the location, but nice place to do a little gambling and see a show.
Good music last night. Free Motown show I guess every Friday. Phil flowers was the special singing guess.

The food at the cafe was terrible. Fish and chips is easy, why it was cooked so poorly, I don't understand. Our waiter left after getting us our entrees; I've never seen that happen. 

The casino itself was tacky, outdated, terribly loud, and disgustingly smokey...and I smoke, so you know that's a problem. It's like they need a new ventilation system or something because it was horrid. I've been to Santa Fe Station numerous times and Texas Station I will never go back to.

Find somewhere else if you can.

Been to this buffet many times. Their Mexican section is terrific. The cajun items are also delicious. The dessert selection is plentiful, which I love. Many buffets skimp on that. The carved meat is great & if you ask for a bigger slice, they gladly oblige. Honestly, when I go to a buffet, I'm there to PIG OUT! Most people are. So, atmosphere isn't a top priority. Nothing fancy about this place, but at less than $10 for lunch, so what. Leave full & happy every time!

Great Casino, clean, big, lot of games, Great Race Book. Lots of food choices and an excellent club. Country Radio hosts events their. Love the whole atmosphere, decor and ambiance, it's a fun place with lots to do. Texas casino is also great for bowling. Everything is good about Texas Casino, it has a great feel to it and Things are spread out, Its a fun place with a Fountain to donate money for a good cause to help the children and Schools. So Hit it Big and contribute to the fountain. Amazed at All the $1 $5 $10 $20 bills in Fountain along with coins. Hopefully it's going where it should go. Good Luck, have Fun, Hit it BIG $$$

A good place to get 99-cent margaritas 'cause my cheap, hood-ass wants to feel classy for about 30 minutes sitting at a bar. I'm not an extreme cheapskate but my wallet needs some gentle lovin' during these trying times haha.

I wanna take a break from drinking a tall can of Pabst Blue Ribbon and since this job transition is taking forever (fucking manager) and I'm on a budget, I wanna get buzzed on the cheap. 

The place is obviously a locals casino and the motif is obviously Texan. Texas Station is not bad at all and they have everything: a theatre, food court, bowling alley, arcade, and a children's playplace (Kid Zone, I think).

Le Texas Station is an affordable oasis for those of us in the NW area. When I move out of the area, I don't think I'll return though, haha.

This review is mainly for the bowling alley. Unlike the Sam's Town, this bowling alley is using Brunswick lanes and knowing that there's an ABT (Amateur Bowling Tournament) going on here, I would've suspected that this place must have maintained the lanes pretty well. I was WRONG! The brunswick lane was so dry, the balls could hardly hook at all and they had ABT here. Lesson learnt, never to participate any tournament here, it's much further from the strip than Sam's Town. Adding to that, this basement couldn't receive any cellphone signal, unlike Sam's Town, so more booo to that!

OK I just want to say that me and my husband came to this location because we heard that they had to. Or we came here and stay for two days we put down $100 deposit but that hundred deposit is under my cousins name but the young lady told us that we still can get that money back as long as we have to be see my name was on the contract as well but we been here for an hour and a half since 9 o'clock this morning it is now 1041 they kept calling managers at the manager that was not here at the time of checkout the young lady at the front desk was not rude but wasn't very helpful I just want to say as a African-American woman this place we got him our money was very very poorThe right-hand don't know what the left hand is doing I am not happy at this location ever ever ever ever ever check here and less you have nowhere else to go

Another stop on the off-strip casino crawl.    The inside is pretty cool looking with a western motif.  They have a bowling alley and a movie theater.  The movie theater lobby looked cool.  The parking structure is a big low building so it is easy to get into and out.  Pretty much seem to offer a lot of amenities the strip casinos offer but in a more manageable size and laid back atmosphere.  Place looks like it has been remodeled a little bit in the several years.  The outside facade looks pretty good.
Bunch of older folk's, and the staff have the personality of a wet dish rag. Cheap room's and drinks, about the only bonus.

you get a 4 because we all won that night lol.
Texas is a good casino.  Big enough to have lots of options.  Tons of food choices, fast food and restaurants.  
Play bingo sometimes here as well.  Lots of tables and the staff is always uber nice.

I have came here a few times to play craps.   Some of the dealers are extremely rude.. I dont know how they make it through there shift with out getting knocked out.   
Buffet is okay..  oyster bar is great. Movie theater are decent

Like George Washington, I cannot tell a lie. Believe me when I tell you the Texas Station is a pretty nice spot. I mean, it's clearly not glitzy like The Bellagio or something, no, but that's not what this casino is trying to be. This place caters to a demographic that's a little less flash/bang/spend and more "I live here, and the margaritas are $1!"

Yes, the margaritas here a dollar. Yes, they also have $2 shots. Yes, that means a lot of working-class people come here to drink and take it easy after work or on a weekend. Personally, that's half the reason I come to the Texas. 

I also come here because they have a movie theater, which is pretty cool. As far as movie theaters go, this one is basic: no IMAX or anything uber cool like that. Also, Austin's Steakhouse is pretty good. I've been there a few times, and I've never disappointed in either the service or the quality of the food. They also have a bowling alley here, though I never go because I suck at bowling. The gambling here is cheap, and I've spent an hour or five at the penny slots. 

All in all, this is a cool place. I enjoy the values, the variety of things to do, and the fact that there is no Strip pretense here.
Texas Station casino is very nice and clean just like all the Station Casinos. Lots of slots and keno! We found it by accident on the way to the Road Kill Grill. We'd definitely go back in the future

What the heck happened to this place? It looks dirty, with people that look like they might actually be homeless sitting at the slots, and the casino itself is practically empty. 

The buffet isn't anything to brag about either. Even for a "locals casino", this place sucks. Probably because it's in a terrible area. 

Yuck!

This is your average "locals" casino.  The facility is pretty nice and there are plenty of things to do here; gamble, bowling, movies, food.  I think that this is one of the nicer local casinos when it comes to cleanliness.
Pretty basic casino for locals.   Sports book, bingo, slots and tables.  A bit smokey but not too bad.

Came to the movies on Christmas night. The theater was packed! Food court had such a long line & we get helped by a really awesome guy who I believe was @ the first cash register, older man. You don't find very nice people now a days. He had amazing customer service, popping jokes. Overall a good experience. Will be coming back :)

This was my 3rd time trying to win any money at this place.  What a rip!  Didn't win a thing.  The sad thing is that the Station Casino's are geared towards the locals.  They don't even give any play anymore.  Just keep taking money from the people who live there to build more casino's...

Two stars for Fatburgers within the casino.

I heard this hotel was best for locals, so I wasn't expecting much from this hotel. I came here with my father to meet my friend and their family, who wanted to stay here because they didn't want to spend a lot of money on a hotel at the Strip, and wanted to visit Las Vegas before moving to the West Coast for a job offer. Despite the cheap price and location in a not-so-nice neighborhood, it is a fine hotel to stay at: you get the bare essentials, it is quiet at night, and you don't have to pay extra for un-necessary add-ons you would have to pay for at a hotel on the strip. It's only 5 miles away from Las Vegas Blvd, but make sure you have a car and options for parking. Also, if you stay at this hotel, you get to have an early bird breakfast for only 4 dollars, which includes pancakes, eggs and bacon or sausage.

This may be one of the only Vegas hotels with nice check in clerks. The buffet is great but waitresses need some training though.They aren't very friendly, mine dumped soda all over my table then just ran away without cleaning it up, I guess thinking I didn't see her. The rooms are too Smokey but I guess that's just Vegas for you. Out of the way and basic but convenient with the movie theater and bowling alley

Winning!!

$1 margaritas all day, every day?!?! For real?!?!  Yes!!! And $2 tequila shots!!

Came here with the local hottie and we spent $6 for two margaritas and two additional tequila shots.  With $1 margaritas, I was expecting something along the lines of a lime slushie.  I was wrong.  For only $6 we got nice and tipsy with no wait and no cover charge.

The only drawback is that I'd be tempted to stop here on the way to work and on the way home every day if I were a local.  It's easy to develop a tequila habit when yummy margaritas are only $1  ;)

Yay, another buffet that I really enjoy. I remember coming here as a child but never really paid attention to how the food was. Right when I walked in it was a pretty chill atmosphere.

As I walked the the Gambling areas I noticed that they had .01 cent machines. (fudging awesome) I walked up paid my $6.99 for the dinner buffet. They have Mexican, Chinese, Italian, Texas barbecue, and many many more options.

My server Adrian was one of the best servers I had in a longs time. She would come over very often asking if everything was OK.
Every single food I tried here was really good.

I would definitely recommend this buffet.
We are LOCALS. Station Casinos SUPPOSELY love locals. We are not pleased. We were ripped off by a bartender. I will NEVER walk into that dump again. GAME OVER.

iam a local wanted to get away for night room was never cleaned had to call 4 times for maid to clean up people in casino looked homeless had to keep a eye on girlfriend didnt trust people there people  never stay there again

This review is strictly on their bowling alley as I've never stayed there, or checked out the other amenities (yet! :) ). When we moved here we wanted to take up a new hobby, and bowling multiple times a week ensued. We've checked out about 6 different lanes so far, and Texas Station is our favorite. They have great prices in the morning, and usually it's relatively quiet! Everyone there is extremely nice, the lanes are clean, the gentleman in the pro shop is helpful, and the garage parking is convenient. Nothing fancy, but always fun on a budget!

First time at the Texas casino. This casino is part of the station casinos. This place looks nicer than the neighboring fiesta casino. I was disappointed on the slot payouts. I played a slot machine with quick hits and bet max bets at $1.50 and hit a bonus with a multiplayer of x2 and after the bonus was over my total win was $14.00...yikes! 

Needless to say I left because it was obvious that I wasn't going to make any money as none of the 5 slots I played on paid me out with the exception of the $14.

Overall the casino does look pretty nice but again disappointed on the payouts.

go to the hotel  for the buffet every week sometimes to times a week pay for the new years eve prime rib buffet get seated then get told you can only have this side of the buffet where there was little to no food to eat I think that is shit  and should have been told first

Booked months ago for a bowling tournament held there. When I arrived they had given my room away and we're sold out. Desk was unable to resolve issue. Manager got involved and found us a clean room,  "Clean"  my @$$! The bed was not properly made and there were beer bottle caps on the floor. Second star is for the bowling alley. They were great. Everything else was crap. Don't stay here.

Stayed here once.  And no joke, on my floor alone we saw police take down a group smoking dope in their room -- and also prostitutes walking around -- saying hello to us.  Yeah.  But other than that "excitement" -- it was an enjoyable stay.  The casino is nice.  The location is a tad off The Strip, but not far.  Rates were extremely low -- probably because they make money off the prostitutes on the side!

Just a great locals casino in the north. The buffet has definitely improved with elevated food items, especially love prime rib nights. Only minus, food does sit for awhile because there's not really much traffic.
Um I just go here if I need to make a sports bet. Old and needs a facelift but not bad. Its a dirty locals place. Not really a tourist spot.
Horrible service they doesn't even care how long did you waited, I wait 4 hours for my room just because the waitress said change the name need time to process

The hotel rooms might not be the most modern ones but they're fair for the price you pay. The room has been (mostly) clean and during our stay the location was very quit (which we were looking for). However, the fact that we had to pay an extra fee of $ 13 per day which has not been mentioned before is an unacceptable business practice not to mention the fact of price distortion.

I stayed in this hotel befor and I will never return again because the area is very unsafe I saw a lot of creepy thugs walking around the entrance of the hotel and around the self parking lot, it's scary place with a bunch of crackheads outside of the hotel and inside ,I found this hotel super unsafe and I would not recommend it to anyone with a family, intill Texas station owner puts better security outdoor of entrance and parking lot. If you want us to return and book more rooms please take care us and make us happy as returning customers.  Thank you hope this review is helpful to everyone.
This is a great place to spend the evening on dinner and entertainment. Great buffet, theatre, games, prices, etc. I like Fiesta Rancho as well.

This hotel has a tacky feel to it. Despite being relatively well maintained. Lower class neighborhood. Plus, our room had a view of a wall only, about 5 feet away. We were on the 3rd floor so we could see the ground, but no sky and nothing but wall no matter how we stretched and craned our necks. I know a hotel needs to rent all available rooms, but how about a discount for a "cell" of a room ? Or at least a warning when checking in ?

They manage two stars due to staff. Everyone we dealt with was pleasant with one exception. The lady in the gift shop was a bit surly.

If only  zero Stars were available. It was a 3 night stay over Christmas- The lack of hospitality provided by 2 of 3 front desk staff, all the cocktail servers, and the rudeness of woman who staffed the gift shop all weekend were disappointing. 
The fact the doors and walls were so thin that we could hear people fighting in the halls, a baby screaming all night we were waking every 45 minutes was exahsting. Not to mention the unsafe feeling due to the type of people allowed to roam the casino begging for cigarettes and punching machines. I have never been in a casino where my husband did not feel good leaving me to step upstairs for a minute. Nor have I ever been in a Las Vegas hotel where some of our family had to switch rooms due to security's inability to control a loud parties in other rooms or have had a Security Guard literally shrug their shoulders when we complained that our entire hallway reeked of marijuana. Texas Station was the first. 
Having to get up at 1245 in the morning to have our AC replaced was inconvenient. Having a machine get stuck and sitting for 20 mins with no response to a service light was frustrating. We were understanding that it was a holiday- however as paying customers we do not anticipate being penalized with a short staffed facility and staff that are not only upset to be working but taking it out on us. 
The entire experience left our entire family saying never a "Station" hotel again.

Spent a few nights here while working security for a weekend event. The hotel is huge, just like the state of Texas. There is plenty to do on the ground floor (gamble, drink, and dine). The free drinks are terrible, my cranberry vodka tasted as if I was drinking Clorox. Gross.

Rooms inside are clean and free of bad smells. The beds are really comfortable, I was surprised! My only complaint in the room I was while staying in, was the shower head. The one located in my room was broken. It took a while to shower, as it would leak out the side or have periods of poor water pressure.

I do wish they would have done a better job addressing the marijuana smoke that could be seen and smelled throughout the 3rd and 4th floor near the elevators. Great place to stay while in Vegas, even won $50 bucks.

This is ridiculous, cannot check in til 3p, even though I'm sure it not busy or sold out, so what do they do between 11a and 3p, just stand there. What a waste of my time, I wanted to check in around 2p.. my family wanted to stay here for the cheaper rate, unfortunately too far from most casinos.
Lots of slots and table games to chose from.
Love the oyster bar and easy parking, plus just a little smoky in casino..

Texas Station is not a casino for tourists, it's one for the community of Las Vegas.  Which isn't to say they shove you out the door if they find you're not Nevadan, but you're not going to be wooed with free slot play and half-price show tickets.  

It's mostly 5-cent and penny slot machines, coupled low-stakes card playing.  The movie theater and food court are decent enough for a local casino, but the gem here is Austin's Steakhouse.   It has great steaks at a 20-40 dollar course range, fine for special occasions.  

The rest of the casino is sort of middling.  Even the casino drink girls are a six out of ten.  The sportsbook is cramped and has about 20 free seats.  Definite local casino.  Again, if you get trapped in it, hide at the steakhouse!

The Texas has clean machines and excellent cocktail service.  I won $200 after playing for only 30 minutes.  If you play the tables at night, you'll be entertained by some young thing dancing on a table right in your line of sight.  I like the Texas and I recommend it.

We stay at the Texas Station once a year. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The buffet is actually pretty good. I am not usually a buffet person. We tried Austin's steak which I give 5 stars. The kids have plenty to do from bowling to a movie or the arcade. I would and have recommended friends to the Texas Station.

This is where I came to see Lorreta Lynn on Saturday night and although the area is incredibly scary (we are talking don't make eye contact/lock your doors scary) once inside you can forget that.

You can get a patron margarita for $10!!!

Not the best selection of what I like to call adult video games (slots) but they have enough to keep you occupied. On Saturday if you had a card for the hotel, frequent customer, as long as it was in a machine you had the chance to win $500! Cool deal. 

The biggest plus for me about this place was the people, EVERYONE was nice. A huge relief and change from the strip where you are a barcode of a person.

We stayed on a Monday night for $30.23 (Used a Groupon deal 15.68/night and 14.55 resort fee) It also came with a coupon book.

- Not very many people come here apparently. We got parking right next to the hotel!
- Upon check in, the black guy at front desk says, "so are you gonna be like him and give me a hard time too? Complain about the $100 deposit!" LOL. "You know I ain't got my readers on, Go head and read me your address!" Come on now...
- "Oh no more king rooms available. I'll put you in 2 queens." WTF.
- Coupon book came with 1 play of free bowling. $3.75 for shoe rental. 
- Horrible fitness center. 2 treadmills but only one working. The tread of the one that is working is coming apart! fail. 
- Hotel room like Palace Station. 3 Star. Great view of a wall! YAY! 
- I agree with Tera, I have ATT and had poor reception at the hotel. 
- Don't play blackjack here. 6:5 6 deck. boo. 
- We ate the Grand Cafe at midnight and got the $1.99 special. Great value.

I wish they had negative stars to describe my experience with the hotel. We were required to stay here for our softball tournament and booked a room with 2 queen beds so my daughter would have a place to sleep. The hotel called us at around 5:30 pm and didn't leave a message. I called them back immediately to make sure that there wasn't an issue with our room. The gentleman who answered was very reassuring and told me there was no issue with my reservation and that he would add notes for a late check-in and make sure our room was held since we were still at the softball fields. When we arrived at the hotel to get our room. We were informed by the lady at the front desk who had the looks and personality of someone who's parents had met on ancestry.com that our only option was a king bed smoking or non-smoking. Our room had been given to someone else, even though they insisted that our room was not given away because they had a single king bed room available. The manager and employee continued to inform us that when you book with any of the Station Properties that your room choice is simply a preference and not guaranteed. That the room choice is really first come first serve and there is no real promise to give you the "bedding type" that you paid for. They told us that we could not have our money back and that they would charge us if we chose to stay or not. So to summarize our experience; never ever stay at the Texas Station hotel. Apparently all the Station Casinos feel the same way so beware of booking at any of their properties.

This is a nice casino for the locals, or people who want to escape the vibe on the strip. The atmosphere here is laid back, and the cocktail service is usually prompt. 

The machines at the bar tend to be a little tight, which you'll find to be the case at most casinos. I found some nickel machines at the end of the Whiskey Bar however, that let me play for a while, while the bartender brought me refills without me even having to ask.

Roaches and porn!!! 

Well it's not my usual type of hotel tht I would stay in, this looks old and smells like smoke as soon as you walk in the casino.  We're only here for the fight, otherwise I'd be near or on the strip.

Ok so first off, we wanted two queens cuz our daughter is with us and a king is just a little cramped, but they couldn't help us.  Then, the room smelled musty and the ac didn't work correctly.  Then I was flipping channels and 3 of them had porn on them, luckily my daughter had her head buried in her Itouch.  We told the front desk and they said that they'll run for 24 hrs after the person ordered them. I think hotels should be able to shut them off as soon as the person checks out. What if my daughter had been paying attention?? That is unacceptable!!!  Then to top it off, I was in bed and looked down to turn the lamp off and saw a roach staring at me. Tht was it!! It turns out that it was only a grasshopper but that's still creepy!! They told us they were completely sold out but then they ended up moving us to a larger room!!!  

On a positive note I do have to say that the staff is extremely nice, in the entire hotel and casino!!

Ok I never understood what a station was until I came here. It's like how they have those fast food/gas stations together...it's kinda gross but convenient because it's two in one. This place has "crack heads" galore. The guys are disgusting and will try to hit on you even walking from the elevator to the front door. The food is whatever, best food was in the cafe area. Don't bother playing the machines they don't pay out at all and you'll be wasting you money. The bed was uncomfortable and has tiny pillows. I'm pretty sure the chair had a cum stain on it. Walking in the hall way you can hear everything going on in every room. No refrigerator or coffee pot in the room so no need to save your left overs but I think if you like stations this is probably a decent one lol but I don't know because this is my first experience at one. I'm giving it two stars because it's convenient (everything in one area) and because it was a good price. If you are one a budget this is better than a motel 6.

The rooms looks old, the beds are hard, all the decor is dated or beat up or in rough shape. It is deafly not one of the best station properties, we probably will not stay here ever again until upgrades are made to the rooms.  They need to spend some of that UFC money on up grading this property.

The only reason I ever come to Texas Station is for the oyster bar. They have those lobster pan roasts that are so delicious. Tides at Sante Fe used to have the same menu, but closed a few years ago. We dined here recently at the oyster bar then played slots and tables for a while afterwards. The casino has really gone down in ambiance and decor in the last few years, but this may be due to the current clientele. The last time I saw a movie here, there was a fight in the lobby in front of the ticket counter. This seems to be the ghetto version of the Sante Fe. They have a food court, Kidsquest, etc, but nothing other than the oyster bar to keep me coming back.

Family in town, so we're making the rounds with them trying many different casinos, looking for the "big win".  I think it's more like they are contributing to our economy, go mom!

Walking around the casino floor, its seems they have spread out the machines, they do not seem to be so crowded, but I noticed they have cut back on some of the table games.  But I do not fear, nearing the holidays, I am sure they will soon move things around again.

Overall, not a bad casino, clean, a little worn, but still a good place to meet with family for a fun night of gambling.
This is my favorite of all the casinos, mainly because there's a lot for me to do here. Great for non-smokers. There are areas and I can go and I can't smell cigarettes at all.

damn i love this place!! wooo hoooo!!!. buffet was great!! like always...i lost $100 at the tables...and made it all back and then some on the slot machine!!! yeah boy!! i am always coming here!! no matter what!! love this place to death!!! wooooohoooooo!!!!!!

Yee to the freaking haw.

I was born and raised in Texas, so when I feel homesick, I go to Texas Station.  Seeing the cast impressions of jalapenos on those support columns always hit the spot to make me feel better.

Okay, so it's not that bad, but I'd be lying if I said I wasn't a little charmed and amused by the theme.

I like "locals" casinos.  They don't try to be anything big and flashy, they just try to be.  And they carry the "Texas" thing enough without overkill.  I don't see a lot of cowpokes with handlebar moustaches that you could swing from like a child's gymnasium, nor do I see belt buckles so large that you could eat a meal off of (If you're wondering, "Tall Tales" are part of any good Texan's verbal repertoire, so I'm just keeping to theme.  It's vital to this review, you see).

I've yet to try the restaurants here, though they do look good enough to be put on my personal "To Do" list.  I doubt that I'll ever book a room here, but I do like their movie theater.  It's actually really nice, and the staff there is top notch.  Seriously, I'm always impressed with the service there.

The casino itself can get a little smoky at times, and some of the kids that hang around there are kind of sketchy, but I'm not filled with a sense of dread when I walk around.  I find this key to a good casino experience.

There may be no basement in the Alamo, but in this instance, I'm glad that there is some "Texas" in this particular Station.  Sure, nobody adds a drawl to conversation, breaks into impromptu hoedowns, or claps in unison after the first two lines of "Deep in the Heart of Texas", but it definitely fits the bill for my synthetic down home experience.

I highly DO NOT recommend to rent a room at this property, especially if you use MARIJUANA. The front desk agent who checked us in was very kind. She gave me a form to initial and sign, with one line stating that although we were in a smoking room, marijuana was not allowed to be smoked in the room. That was perfectly fine with me, or else I wouldn't have initialed and signed the form. I gave them $100 in incidentals to ensure no damages to the room per the contract I signed. 

When we got to the room, a shampoo bottle was laying on the floor of the room and the fire detector was off the wall. From my experience working in the hotel industry, I understand housekeeping is very busy and they work hard to maintain the quality of the rooms thus why it wasn't a big deal that a couple things were missed in the room by housekeeping. I also understand that an employee probably will not admit to failing to tell their supervisor about the tampered fire alarm.

I had marijuana in the room, which is legal in the state of Nevada. Because of the paperwork I signed, I left the hotel room twice in order to smoke. Apparently you can't have any evidence of marijuana ever being in the room (which was not specified in the contract) or you'll be accused of smoking it in the room. For anyone who smokes, just don't bring it to the room or they'll keep your $100 incidental deposit. 

They apparently made their own law that marijuana is illegal in their hotel and are taking advantage of the fact I'm a 23-year-old who provided an Illinois ID. Is it more typical for a young adult to not obey the rules? Was I taken advantage of because of my age, or because they assumed I don't travel to Vegas often? I can only assume that.

The incompetent employees who treated me like a criminal said they did not have proof I smoked it in the room, only that it was in the room. The incompetent manager, Greg, said the same thing but that he "believed me" and "how deeply sorry he was that he couldn't refund me my $100" which is false. I was trained to know whether marijuana was smoked in the room or if the smell of present marijuana was simply lingering in the room, but yet Greg promised me that his manager Amalia (spelling?) agreed with him. 

Greg wouldn't give me the number to corporate which I found odd, but only informed me that I can speak to the general manager, Stacy Stagg, who I am only assuming is as incompetent as the management she hired. 

The property looked really cool from the outside and was very close to the dispensary I LEGALLY purchased the marijuana from, so I decided to stay for a night. I liked the fact that parking was so close to the entrance of the hotel also. It is a great property that is disappointingly poorly managed.

I've never had anyone steal from me, and this establishment accomplished that. They lost a customer who wanted to come back, but now won't because they would rather have my $100 that was not deserved. I was punished for a housekeeper's lack of responsibility and for being a 23-year-old out-of-towner who simply possessed LEGAL MARIJUANA. 

For anyone else who has had issues with this property and are not being provided the number to corporate, it is 702-495-3000.

It's a nice quiet place for people who love to relax and want to be far away from the chaotic Vegas Strip.  I love the fact that this particular casino has a movie theater, bowling alley and a variety of restaurants... 

Down side, their buffet food isn't the greatest, but it isn't worst either. I didn't win anything at this place... Poor me!

PLEASE dont waste your time or money going here! We got 2 nights king room for our 1 year anniversary (before going to a gifted timeshare) and im so glad I ddnt stay longer than 2 nights. 1st off our tub was DIRTY im talkin someones booger, hair and lotion on the wall of the freaking shower. The bed looked worn.   ( u shaped) and had a possible adjoining room so we heard our neighbors cussing out their kids and being loud in the am. Didnt mind all the black people, didnt feel "unsafe" but the hallway smelt like weed strongly. And no ac in halls. Even for a good deal of less than $40 for both nights (groupon) I wouldnt go again. Pool is pitiful thats y they dont even mention they have one. Not kidding. Hot tub size pretty much. Didnt use it. Just overall not a great experience at all. Bowling alley sucks. Movie theatre is average. Bleh. Thats about it. Will NEVER EVER come again. 

 They also sent me an email saying I had a reservation for the day I checked out,  to come check back in for 1 night so I had to call once I had already left. Waited on phone 10 minutes only to be told they had no record of a reservation and that my card wouldnt be charged again. Bars are closed or stink...seriously

As Casino's go, this isn't the most exciting or the most glamerous.  In fact, it is simply one of the average Station Casinos.  That said, the buffet is a great deal, they still have some old school slot games and I found $3.00 blackjack the other day.   If you want to make your money go farther, $3.00 blackjack is the way to go.  

Like so many other casinos, you walk in and immediately smell like smoke for the rest of the day.  I can't last 1 hour in herear without my allergies acting up.
They still have some of the older slots and I won 30 dollars playing Texas Tea.

All your Station Rewards work here and it is usually less crowded than Red Rock!

For bargain value a 3 star but they need some renovations to get overall 3 stars.  Still, if you want lower gambling limits and less crowds, this is the place to be.

So I'm not one to complain....ever. Went to check in, I went to hotel registration to check in. I had made the reservation in mine and my husband's names.
