The women at the desk told me my name was not on the reservation and she could not help me.....i had walked across the very large parking lot while my husband sat in the the vehicle with our sleeping children. To say I was upset is nice....i then had to walk across the parking lot again. The the same women was overly sweet to my husband and very accommodating. Not a nice start to a stressful work week!!!!

Texans You will be so disappointed if you ever visit this Casino and Buffet. Horrible Buffet All the food was old & day before left overs. Once they ran out of food thats it! Nothing was made fresh, rude chefs poor attitudes just a bad overall experience. We will never be back here, folks that come here either come here to die or come here to play bingo. Id recommend a bulldozer to level this Casino then build a new Casino true to Texas roots that Texans can be proud and brag & appreciate ! 
This Casino is going down hill fast with no brakes .
If you ever decide to come here then like the old saying goes you pay for what you get.

This casino/hotel isn't one of my favorite places to gamble, but it is one of the places I do like to eat. The oyster bar does has some slammin' seafood and there is also a nice place to catch a buffet with variety. This place isn't all that enticing to come to if you're going to gamble, but if it is a a place close to your house, I wouldn't mind coming here at all rather than hitting the strip.

If I could give them NO stars I would. Never should you be flying all day and get to a hotel and they say "Oh sorry we have no rooms but the one way across town does. Go there or we can cancel this reservation PENALTY FREE." It is SO INCONSIDERATE TO DO THAT. People have been driving and flying all day long. The LEAST they could've done was call the people who had reservations and let them know what was going on instead of standing behind the desk looking ridiculous and just casually telling people they have no rooms drive 25-30 across town to this other hotel. Very poor management.

Have eaten at this Buffet 3 times, always give em at least 3....The food was absolutely horrible, dried pans of food on the line, staff serving the the ribs/bbq was an absolute dull uncaring individual and after the 3rd time, we will never eat there again.  The only thing that was decent was the salad, tho not much to choose from....I mean how can you screw up that.  There is a digital billboard inside that states: "Voted best in Las Vegas"....NOT TRUE  You will be disappointed.
Place was a little smokey but other than that rooms were clean and nice the bars were fun and the steak house was really amazing I'll be coming back next year.

I didn't stay at the hotel or gambled. I actually came here for the buffet. The buffet prices are wonderful $11.99/adult, and my 3 and 2 years old were free. Go there expecting a Rio setting, but without a doubt the food was delightful. This casino also has a kids care; they watch your kids while you lose money. There's also a movie theater in the casino, next to a ticket game/arcade and a bowling alley - which i didn't get to check out. This is my 3rd time there, and I always enjoy it. Minus the 2 stars because they need to improve the ventilation up in there.

Like this casino and hotel. Especially the theaters with the matinee special for senior day which is Wednesday before 4:00pm. Costs is now $4.00 for seniors.  But they did raise the age qualifications from 50 years old and over to 60 years old and over which was a little surprised with the change but still can't beat the price on senior matinee day.  Actually the person I talked to gave the wrong information about $ & age? Senior Day is now Thursdays! 50+. Sorry, Alliante Casino is discount day not Texas Casino & Hotel. WiFi in casino is free. Price for senior discount on Wednesday you can't beat. Bringing your children to movies here would be fine. Also, arcade for children to have some fun. For a local casino and movie theater,  definitely recommend.

Not one thing to be disappointed in thus far.  There was a short wait at checkin but when it was our turn, Kimiko took extraordinary care and patience with us, granting all our requests to the letter.  We asked for room on the top floor as far from the smoky casino as possible, with a nice view of the pool and Strip.  Only three room from elevator and ice machine.... Convenient and no noise.

I see people complaining about the rooms... Well, they weren't staying in this room.... Clean, comfy with two nice chairs, king bed with a new firm mattress.  What's to complain about?  Nothing except maybe a desk would be preferable to the small little telephone table on the opposite of the room from the bed, but not a biggy!

I found the casino to be clean, huge and filled with lots of slots, nice bars and eating establishments.  Thanks Texas Station!  Your place rocks for this old lady from Tucson!

** Casino Only**

Been here many times over the years just to gamble,

It is a bit far for tourists to stay here and go to the strip but it is more of a locals casino,

It is part of the station casinos which you can use your players card here as well. We have been here for the buffet too.

As for the casino it is nothing fancy.  We have played slot machines a bunch of times and have never won anything worth speaking of. 

It is a pretty good size casino and they have a good amount of slot machines. When you play here you do get buffet specials.

We don't go out of our way to go here only if we are in the area.

I get there at 12 according to my cell phone girl is there sitting on her butt and said she doesn't open until her clock says 12 and her clock says 11:56. Okay so we wait and then she says they need the shot records which can't transfer from the red rock. Ok so then she let's us know she can look them up. So our movie was 12:15, twenty minutes later she sees the youngest isn't 2 1/2 and there's not enough employees to cover, they need 3 of them there's only 2. She couldn't see the girl was 1? Really? And they need three employees for three kids!? Girl was rude, lazy, and ignorant. They need staff that actually likes kids, and knows what they're doing. Horrible place!!!!!! Red rock is way better!!!

I went here on a Thursday paid 38,99 for two people. Don't waste your money, go to Paris, Rio or Bellagio for that kind of money. 

What a rip off! The only thing there that was semi good was the pork spare ribs.. except that.. everything was pretty crap!

I did Rio.. it was a lot better buffet for almost the same amount of money. 

Also there were a lot of cigarette smoke in there from the Casino!

Parently on Wednesdays its only $12.. I say.. go somewhere else..

Yes, it's a big casino with all the expected Station amenities. I'd never spent a significant amount of time here before, and I guess it was a little better overall than I expected. I did notice all the Texas themes throughout the casino, which carry into the restaurants and some bars. 
Parking was pretty easy, with garage access from Lake Mead. 

The "showroom" was a conference room with weird seating, and they were too close together. Luckily, the seat next to me on one side was unoccupied. I was there for Peabo Bryson, and the show was great, with nice stage lighting. Prior to the show, I paid a visit to the Martini Bar, which serves free potato chips made at Austin's Steakhouse. They also have very big martini glasses. All the better to indulge in a coffee martini! Be sure to check out the chandeliers in this bar. Live music on Friday nights is Motown, which is a reason to return.

This is not my favorite casino, even though the bells started going off and I "won" 500 pennies, which I promptly returned.  I do like some stuff here, namely it's still $1 per point, unlike MGM.  But now they're starting to roll in those .40 and .50 minimum bet penny machines, just like the Big Boys, and that pisses me off.  I like playing slots as a mindless diversion.  I don't like to lose more than $40 or $50.  I never go with the idea that I'm going to win, so I'm never disappointed.  I NEVER WIN!!  EVER.  If I come out a couple of dollars ahead, I"m satisfied.  But you can't do that with a machine that gobbles all your money in two minutes. I'll wait and see if this trend continues here. 

The other feature I like at Texas Station is the Texas-shaped pavers that lead to the entrance doors.  Nice touch.  But not much, eh?

I had high hopes for this being a wonderful stay. I had made my reservations in advance and paid in full in advance. The front desk was very nice a little slow with the people ahead of me, but I can understand language barriers when they're dealing with people who barely speak English. I then got my turn and check-in was handled easily. So I went off to my room. As I went into the room I noticed there were ashtrays. As I had paid in advance for a non-smoking room so I immediatly went back to the front desk. At the front desk I was told then my reservation held me a spot in the hotel, but did not guarantee non-smoking I said this was unacceptable and I needed to have it fixed I was told there was one other room in the place and it too was a smoking room. I walked away as the clerk repeated their policy, in a wonderfully smooth voice. I am sure that this verbage was repeated any times to many people. When I pay in advance and make my request, I expect it to be there. This is a dealbreaker and will forever put this beautiful facility on the buyer beware list. I won't be returning, ever.
 The room was clean I got to give them that and did not have a smoky smell to it.  I got to give it to them that they clean very well, but I was extremely disappointed and upset that I didn't get what I paid for in advance. For this reason I'm going to give them a pretty low review no matter what the rest of the facility. Yes the parking was wonderful and easy,  OK for water pressure was great, The towels were nice okay. The TV works great,  but give me what I paid for in advance or tell me in advance that you're going to give me whatever you damn well please when I get there. Beware go somewhere else there are many choices in Las Vegas, I will be using them

Off the strip, but excellent price ($60 a night). Don't get fleeced by $200-500 a night joints on the strip.

Very clean, quiet room for a casino/hotel.

Very fast check-in and check-out.

Free wireless Internet access.

They also have fast food places inside.

The buffet here is really quite good, and inexpensive too.  Their made to order al pastor tacos are really good !!!  They make chicken and beef fajitas too and they are very good too.  Its a great place for lunch.  The only downside is the screaming children that sometimes populate the place, but at least they seem NOT to handle the food on the buffet line, so its not too bad.
